column182: Why should you buy a ticket for one person when you can save buying a group ticket ? So Open or Join to a Group !
column183:
My Circle is the app that makes you join into a group of people who want to visit at a specific day the same place, as Museums – Concerts – Theatre – Cinema etc. The aim is to prevent crowding at the box office and individual tickets.
According to a quick research, studying the Italian theme parks network, (from Gardaland to the Acquario di Genova) we can easily notice that the individual tickets average price is 28€, instead groups average price is 21€. That is 25% discount off the single ticket sale price (estimate based on 6 theme parks).
All Members join the Group with their own credit card in order to guarantee the prospective payment. The amount will be blocked on the credit card, and the transaction will come to pass when the Group reaches the appropriate number of members; then all the members will receive their tickets by e-mail.
Groups allow people to save money and are a good way for companies to make purchases easier. Our strong point is an organized community looking for money-saving chance, using the same service with an average reduction of 25%, and a maximum of 35%. The Community, thanks to various My Circle offers, will be glad to use the app whenever is possible, for a single day visit as well as for a longer visit. The point is “together we can save money” ! The point of strength is the app usability and the chance to join a group to save money.

column10: Building Childhood Life Story- Early Childhood Educators and Family
column16:
Remini is a platform (Mobile app for iOS and Android, and a Website) for educators and families to create each child's life story. 

For the educators Remini improves communication with parents in private and simple environment. 
Educators document special activities, achievements, progress, interactions, milestones… 
They organize & share class materials.

For the Family Remini enables to save forever their child’s precious moments: milestones, height, creations, smiles,share with Family, and don’t miss moments when the child is in school.

Business Model
Our business model is composed of subscription model for parents/preschool teachers and ordering prints/merchandising related to the child. Recently Remini successfully tested these models. Targeted marketing is an optional model that will be evaluated at a later stage.

Current State
Remini has a working product in smartphones (ios, android) and the web, had a successful pilot in the Israeli market, with hundreds of daily active preschools and more than 30,000 Users. The amount of material uploaded per active user is more than twice in comparison to Facebook. Remini started expending internationally with endorsements  from several preschool organizations including ECE-RJ, USCJ, Chabad.
Remini has raised investment from Heli Bennun and Zohar Zisapel.

Competition
Remini has several competitors, in child photo albums sector charging subscription fee of 36-40$ (Keepy, Lifecake- which was recently acquired by Canon) and in the parent-teacher sector (Tadpoles, Kaymbu- charging 2.25$ per child per class monthly).
column17: Remini uniquely combines educators and families, combines instant group messaging and sharing, with the long term storing and documenting.

column182: Remini enables to build your childrens lifestory by their parents, family and pre-school teacer
column183:
Remini is a platform (Mobile app for iOS and Android, and a Website) for building your child's life story. The idea is that instead of scattering each child's memories between different platforms (e.g. facebook, gmail, picasa), Remini is a place which is dedicated to each child, where his close surrounding – family, close friends and kindergarten teachers share and document his memories by uploading pictures, videos and text and categorize these into albums.  Imagine you could browse through your childhood memories and find with a snap of a finger your first steps, your first fallen tooth, your childhood drawings and funny quotes. 
Remini uniquely combines the ease of instant group messaging and sharing, with the long term storing and documenting which is done seamlessly. At any time there is an option to look back at all the special moments and memories and create beautiful slide shows, presentations, decorations and order prints with a tap of a finger.
column185: We are currently working on 3 goals in parallel. First we want to widen our user base globally by marketing, and by increasing the virality of our app. Secondly, we are continuously working on our product in order to improve user retention. And last, we are begining to look for our next round of Investment, which we plan to conduct within the next 6 months.

column196: We like to divide our comptetitors into 4 segments: General instant messaging services (e.g. Whatsapp, Telegram, Facebook messanger, email services etc..); Cloud storage providers (e.g Picasa, Dropbox, flickr, etc..); Social networks (e.g facebook, twitter, google+, etc..); and the group which is more similar - family-centric solutions (e.g 23snaps.com, tweak-a-boo, etc..). Remini combines all of these solutions into one holistic child-oriented solution.

column182: Brighten is a positive social network that enables users to say funny or nice things anonymously to their friends and colleagues
column183:
On the morning of April 1st, 2013 Brighten CEO Austin Kevitch received a Facebook message that read, “Oliver has passed away in a tragic climbing accident”. Friends began posting on Oliver’s Facebook wall, showing their appreciation for the positive impact he had made on their lives. Inspired, Austin bought a box, a pen, and a pack of sticky notes. He then left this compliment box on a table outside his dorm – by the end of the box was overflowing with anonymous notes. It Brightened someone’s day each time they received an anonymous note, and it was even more fun to write them. We want to extend that feeling to as many people as possible.

Brighten gives you the superpower of anonymity, and lets you use it for something good. Make someone's day by writing nice things to your friends, family, and colleagues. Isn't it about time we use an app based on kindness? Studies in human psychology show that one of the most important controls of our behavior are the established norms within any given community. Brighten is the first anonymous online community based on positivity, appreciation, and kindness. Everyone has their own 'home feed' to see all the nice things their friends are saying to each other. Creative ways to use Brighten: give anonymous compliments, ask anonymous questions, share secret confessions, funny inside jokes, express feelings. We are also building our mobile SaaS enterprise version for positive reinforcement and constructive criticism within the workplace.
column185: By the end of Capital Innovators Accelerator Program we hope to have acquired valuable mentorships and some funding to expand our team. Additionally, we hope to have 100,000 monthly active users, 50% of 3-5 college/high-school campuses, and 10 companies using Brighten's enterprise version.

column195: Brighten is the first social network that is leveraging anonymity to facilitate compliments, confessions, questions, and inside jokes amongst friends. Unlike other anonymous offerings in the space, we eschew gossip and seek to promote quality conversations revolving around appreciation. Instead of “Secrets” or “Whispering”, Brighten was created for the sole purpose of brightening people’s day. Our enterprise version has also been well recieved; the first five beta businesses came to us!
column196: Other anonymous apps include Whisper(whisper.sh/) and Secret(www.secret.ly/). These serve more as gossip outlets and de-individualize users into cyber-bullying because they lack personal profiles and unique identifielike Brighten. People are going to use social media, why not encourage them to use it in a positive way? Only anonymous app where the core interaction is 1-1 and is amongst friends. Brighten App Shows Some Promise: Why Apps Like Secret Might Not be the Answer http://bit.ly/1mvE7TU

We are also amassing a passionate team of reps from college campuses nationwide and leveraging existing relationships with business owners and social media celebrities. The key to reaching large enterprises is via SMB'S – they are the perfect initial customers.

column209: Our greatest challenge right now is funding. We have a great team assembled with all the pieces in place (UX/UI Designer, Product Manager, Front End Developer, and Back End Developer) but it's hard for us to all work 60-80 hours a week when we aren't being compensated for our time. Brighten is a great idea and it's easy to get users to opt in, but our greatest challenge will be keeping our engagement numbers high.

column182: As advertisers lose access through print/radio/TV, Xooker delivers the next gen ad platform...real-time, location aware, relevant, personal.
column183: With Xooker, restaurants and retailers get new customers, and keep them, through a powerful combination of personalized messaging, automatic check-in, games, rewards, and analytics.  Most current digital marketing solutions -– ads, prepaid deals, coupons, loyalty programs -- address acquisition or loyalty. Xooker does both.  Plus, because Consumers opt-in, our analytic engine gathers information about actual behavior across multiple interactions.  Merchants match the right messages at the right time. Consumers get more of what they want when they want it.  Their spending increases and they return to the Merchant more often.  A valuable relationship develops for both through this mobile-first consumer engagement platform.
column185:

column195:
4 key differentiators:
1.  Restaurants and retailers can both get new customers and keep them. Other solutions offer one or the other.
2.  Our analytic engine gathers information about actual behavior across multiple interactions to help merchants personalize messages to groups of customers, and even to individuals.  
3.  Consumers choose what types of products and services, and even what Merchants, they get messages and offers from. 4.  We make the experience fun for Consumers, through games.
column196: Xooker is well positioned vis companies that compete against various aspects: 1) daily deals--poor merchant economics & no ongoing customer engagement. 2) loyalty programs--do not help acquire new customers. 3) game company rewards--not  tied into ongoing engagement. 4) shopping apps - little engagement when not shopping, and typically not for local merchants. 5) merchant apps - subject to user app overload, and no data across multiple Merchants. Merchants will be reluctant to switch - lose data
column197: Xooker is free to Consumers. Merchants also have free basic access through our “freemium” business model. They pay for enhanced services, including advertising, sponsorships, prepaid deals, and most importantly, targeted messaging options, refined with our analytics. One-time Merchant acquisition costs average $400. Annual revenue per Merchant averages $5,000.
column198: At launch, a strategic partner will cross-sell to its opt-in database of over 1 million mobile users and 2,500 merchants. We will further develop the Merchant base through a direct sales force leveraging strategic partner intro's of Sysco Foods and Nat'l Restaurant Association, and through affinity marketing. We will develop the Consumer base by: 1) solicitations on-location at Xooker merchants, 2) charity affinity programs, 3) rewards for social sharing, and 4) local media ads & PR.
column200:
We have the following traction:
1) Partner mobile marketing company has customer base of 2500 merchants and 1m consumers.  Many merchants have been queried about Xooker features, and over 90% want them. 93.7% of consumers re-opted in earlier in 2014 to continue receiving messages.
2) Interest from Sysco Foods for us to be an iCare marketing partner.
3) Nat'l Rest Assoc interest for endorsement

column10: Predictive Outbound Lead Generation SAAS
column16: We help convert qualified prospects into qualified leads. We do this by using big data to better identify qualified prospects who are then incented to take a measurable action and provide feedback to determine appropriate lead score using predictive analytics.
column39: Co-founder, Chief Product Officer
column40: Software Development,Data Analysis,Software Design,Product Launch,Marketing Research
column52: Founder and CEO
column180: St. Louis Business Journal, Twitter, Other
column182: BarrelFish helps identify and then convert quality prospects into quality leads
column183:
BarrelFish is a predictive outbound lead generation SaaS platform that uses proprietary data science algorithms and big data analytics to convert prospects into quality leads. BarrelFish uses big data sources to find prospects, score those prospects on demographic, psychographic and social data points to provide the best prospects for outbound marketing. Once identified, BarrelFish's incentive engine gets the prospects to take a measurable action and provide specific feedback. That feedback and all other relevant data points are used to create an accurate lead score. Highest scored leads are delivered to clients' sales team while lower scoring leads that are interested, but not ready to buy, are automatically nurtured using BarrelFish software. 

BarrelFish software is in beta and with early adopters we have achieved a 10x industry average outbound direct marketing response rate.
column185: BarrelFish is currently generating revenue. Our plans for expansion, which involves our transition to a SaaS, is currently underway. This expansion would be accelerated by the money, resources, guidance, as well as the exposure from being selected by the Capital Innovators Accelerator Program.
column186:
Paul Burkemper - Chief Executive Officer - managing company vision and team 
Brian Schwartz - Chief Product Officer - managing product development
Dan Klein - Chief Sales Officer - leading our sales effort
David Meyer - Chief Marketing Officer - managing our marketing and branding
column188:
Paul started and subsequently sold an independent financial services company including a tax and insurance practice.
Dan founded a firm that was subsequently acquired by Primavera Systems. 
Brian, Dan and David co-founded Spoke Marketing. A full-service marketing agency. 
Brian was also a partner in Engage Software two years after they were founded.
column190: Dan and David are partners at Spoke Marketing. Although Spoke requires much of their attention, BarrelFish benefits from their extensive connections as well as their ability to recommend BarrelFish to their marketing clients.
column194: St. Louis - moving to CIC in early 2015
column195: We have a comprehensive solution that not only identifies quality prospects but then gets those prospects to take a measurable action and provide specific feedback which is then used to assign an accurate and meaningful lead score. Not only is our SAAS easy to onboard and reasonably priced but our solution has realized an average response rate of 5% for our clients outbound lead generation campaigns which is 10 times the industry average. Bottom line, we get our clients message heard.
column196:
BlueKai - now part of Oracle's Marketing Cloud - http://www.bluekai.com/
BlueKai is geared towards enterprise client's and isn't a standalone SAAS and provides the data, but not the execution of outbound direct marketing.

Lattice Engines - http://www.lattice-engines.com/ Lattice Engines requires a third-party SAAS to execute marketing campaigns and their on-boarding process is very complex. Onboarding fees have been high as $50,000.
column197:
We charge a one-time onboarding of $5,000. In addition to onboarding, our monthly subscription fee ranges from $399 to $999 depending upon amount of contacts and data needed. We fulfill and profit from margin on our incentives. Average client revenue is estimated to be $20,000 / year. 

We sell to mid-sized growth companies with higher dollar and margin, complex sales. Because of existing connections, we are initially targeting IT software providers that fit the aforementioned criteria.
column198: Initially, we are finding clients by targeting our existing relationships and "BarrelFish-ing" them (eating our own dog food). Initial sales efforts have yielded close to a 10% response rate with an anticipated close rate of over 50%. By focusing on partner channels, we anticipate the numbers of clients to scale quickly - if it works for one partner, chances are that the other partners will subscribe (ie: IBM alone has 10,000 partners, most of which are potential clients).
column200: Our initial solution was a lifestyle business using our software. We have been actively transitioning towards a SAAS because of the massive growth / scalability potential. Revenues for our lifestyle business were closing in on $500,000; however, revenues are down as a result of not focusing on that business. In other words, we have taken two steps back so that we can take a thousand forward.
column201:
We are currently focused on sales of our existing early adopter solution which is a proven strategy and software that works. However, each client setup still requires developer effort to launch a new campaign. 

As such, as we continue to sell this solution to generate revenue and gain clients, our primary goal is to transition into a fully functional SAAS as soon as possible. The time required to accomplish this is solely a function of money. Our model works but what we need now is money to pay for additional developers to develop a completely automated onboarding process (with support provided to help clients onboard, as needed).  With funding, our target date to deploy the SAAS is second quarter of 2015.
column208: Our current plans are to initiate a convertible debt offering of $1,000,000 in $50,000 increments to fund the SAAS development. Our pro-forma estimates a series A offering in 2018 to continue growth and research and development.
column209: Our biggest challenge is time. The sooner we can make the transition to a SAAS, the sooner we can scale. Raising funds will enable us to expedite that process and because our solution involves machine learning (gets better and better with time) it will allow us to create a bigger barrier to entry for potential competitors..

column65: A curious sack of chemicals that loves learning, tinkering, hacking & gardening.
column72:
I built a life for myself and my wife in Australia.

I’m born and raised Nepal, where the caste system still exists. While at school a girl named Bandana, and I, fell in love. Bandana and I are from different castes, which meant that our relationship was resolutely forbidden by our culture and our families. 

So, we put our heads together and concocted a plan: to convince our parents to allow us to attend university overseas, in Australia. 

The plan worked, but I had no financial support and had to work two jobs to pay the exorbitant international student fees. I'm proud of the fact that I managed to complete my degree with distinction.

Bandana and I married last year in Nepal, with the (begrudging) blessings of our family :)
column182: We're building a wiki of community-sourced reviews and ratings about people.
column183:
Karma has two main points of difference. The first is that it is focussed on a very specific, currently untapped niche: reviews about people. And the second is, for the first time on a social platform, the information about a person will not be created or vetted by that individual.

We provide solutions these 4 problems:
1.) Learning about a person. We currently have the following main options: Google, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, or asking a mutual connection. With enough digging we may gather the data we need, but none of these solutions provide a simple snapshot of a person's reputation.
2.) Writing a positive review. We can thank someone publicly by tagging them in a Facebook post (just two days after writing this sentence, Facebook released their “Say Thanks” feature). This is a nice gesture, but as it is not public or searchable information, it has limited utility to the person being thanked.
3.) Writing a negative review. When someone has harmed us, we may wish to warn others. A friend of mine recently let his house out while he was overseas. When he returned he found that the tenants had left his home in a state of disrepair. My friends would liked to have warned others against engaging with the these people, but there is currently no way for him to do so.
4.) Leveraging your reputation. People leverage their reputations through word of mouth within a specific community. But what happens if we relocate to a different city or country, or change companies or industries

column196: LinkedIn, Google, Facebook, and Yelp are the most obvious competition. They all have a great interest in social data, well established user bases, and the means to produce a similar product in a short period of time. Despite the tremendous value these companies provide they have not established a system of people reviews. We understand that people want objective and truthful information, and that it’s worth taking on the controversy we’ll inevitably face by providing it.

column198:
We intend to launch our MVP at a university. They are very interconnected communities, and students are typically tech-savvy and socially active. They also use online reviews to inform their decisions.

We recently had a meeting with Stephen Parker, the Vice Chancellor of the University of Canberra. He loved the idea, and was positive about us using the university as an early test bed. Once we’ve created sufficient uptake within a community, it’ll be easier for the product to spread organically.
column200: We plan to hire a designer and specialist frontend developer in early January, and start building the system immediately thereafter.
column201: To launch our MVP. We’re currently refining the product design and features, and building our team. We plan to start coding in January, and launch by April.
column208: We’re currently looking for seed funding; we’re applying to a number of startup accelerators and government grants. Initial projections suggest we need approximately AU $70K to get us to the point of launching an MVP in April. Beyond that, if the data from our launch looks as impressive as I hope it will be, we’d like to raise about a million dollars to ramp up development and marketing.
column209:
Our biggest challenge at the moment is finding a great programmer. While Dayne has a degree in computer science and worked as a games programmer, he has not been in the industry for 5 years and has little experience with web programming. 

However, we recently began a relationship with former Google and Quora software engineer, Manish Jain. Manish has offered to mentor us through our tech problems, and he’s assisting us in finding and hiring a suitable programmer.

Another big problem that we’ll soon face is getting early traction/adoption. It’s the dreaded “chicken and egg” problem that startups like ours inevitably have to overcome. We’ve thought a lot about this, and we’re confident that we have a strategy to break the deadlock:

> Create a powerfully emotive marketing campaign - Karma is a marketers dream.
> Think small - Identify a small community of our most likely early adopters, and launch a blitzkrieg marketing push aimed at getting significant uptake within the community as soon as possible. 
> Create a product that is intuitive, beautiful, and inspiring
> Be agile - leap, test, measure, and pivot fast - we plan to launch a MVP by April

column10: Would love for my efforts to result in helping others in a meaningful way.
column182:
BrightBod is an alternative to Health Insurance for people who cannot afford Health Insurance or who opt out of purchasing Health
Insurance.
column183:
What we know, and therefore, what we are betting on (that no one else yet realizes) is that our users will give us permission to sell their medical data (if we pay them). In other words, we are helping the people to sell their medical data. This is going to be the future. In short, 1) we're selling medical data, 2) we're helping the users sell their medical data (so they can share in the profits, unlike every other company currently selling data) and 3) we're creating a Healthcare universe that is an alternative to Health Insurance, that saves people's lives.
In addition, BrightBod makes it much easier for everyone to avoid doctor visits, whether they have insurance or not, period. 
With BrightBod, no longer are you stuck with the doctors in your local area.With BrightBod, make the ultimate medical dream team with absolutely NO INSURANCE. 
Pick the very best doctors in the USA or search in your own city.Purchase a 10-minute video conference with your dream doctor. If you want a second or third opinion, schedule 10-minute video conferences with other doctors as well. The 10-minute video conference is inexpensive for the user and can answer all of his or her questions. This intellectual property is also patent-pending. 
Why would anyone ever go to a doctor's office again if they can talk to their own local doctor (or, instead, their dream doctor) without ever leaving his or her home? Before BrightBod, 10 minutes are wasted...with BrightBod, 10 minutes turns into money.

column182: XLR8 is the match.com for the entrepreneurship ecosystem, linking urban and rural communities at the grassroots level.
column183:
XLR8 is the online social matching platform that links rural and urban communities at the grassroots level, bringing together startups, investors, mentors and entrepreneur support organizations (ESOs). We give entrepreneurs a distinct advantage by connecting them to the most relevant people and organizations based on their needs throughout their region and beyond, all while supporting and strengthening the ESOs that serve them.
XLR8 provides individual users access to a robust social online entrepreneurship community with an intelligent, proprietary matching engine that creates otherwise unlikely encounters and provides the best possible match for entrepreneurs, mentors, investors and resources across an expanded ecosystem. This reduces the capital burn rate, increases the likelihood for entrepreneurial success and allows for additional employment opportunities. ESOs purchase a portal for $1,000 per month that is free for their constituents to utilize, thus gaining analytic information of their users’ interactions and needs, visibility for their startups to angel investors and vetted mentors from across the country, a shared library of best practices, original and curated media content to support ESOs' local incubation efforts, effectual resource sharing with other organizations, event management for regional "collaboratitions” as well as access to consultants and motivational speakers.

column182: Provide live time, face to face, audio visual connectivity.
column183:
We will bundle a telecommunications pod that will enable you  to sit across the table from another person and have a face to face, eye to eye, conversation, even though they may be thousands of miles away or across town. 
This is different from other audio visual telephony in that the camera is mounted on the screen at eye level so you are actually looking the other person in the eye.  It is also a single unit device specifically designed for internet audio visual communication.  The device is large enough that the person on the other side of the table is lifesize.  
The initial project would be sold and installed in a corporate owned chain restaurant or coffee house, as exclusive for early acceptance and then later scaled out to other adopters.  It would enable the customer to communicate with a distant friend and make arrangements to meet at restaurant X at a specific time.  One would go to the X in Boston and one to the X in St Louis.  They would pull the unit over to the table and log in.  The lunch or coffee would be from the same source and the decor would match also contributing to the realistic sense of spending focused, one-on-one time with another person.
Yes, people can do this at home.  They can also watch movies at home, but they still go to the theater.

column10: Deliver university cultural insight by connecting students via phone chat.
column11: Education,Social Enterprise,Cultural Awareness,Education Technology,Marketing Research,Data & Analytics,Marketing,Data Mining
column16:
UpperClassmen.co is a platform that facilitates conversation between current and prospective college students over the phone. By utilizing our platform, prospective college students will gain a first hand glimpse into the lifestyle and culture of any university nationwide. 

On our platform, students will be able to discuss a wide variety of topics about college. "How are the dorms?" "How challenging was the transition from high school to college?" And much more! For prospective students, this is an amazing opportunity to get insight from their peers, who they can trust. Furthermore, prospective students can select the specific current student they wish to speak with. Our platform will make it possible to search by University, Major or even interest in order to find the perfect student match at each school.

Current college students will get rewarded for not only speaking with prospective college students, but also for pulling prospective students to the platform. Current college students are very involved with social media and have direct access to their peers a few years younger. In addition, these younger peers trust and look up to these current students. 

By leveraging the experience of the current students, prospective college students can make the most informed choice when it come to which school to apply to, and ultimately attend.
column17: We give prospective college students a dynamic way to learn about college from the most honest source out there, the current student.

column46:
I wouldn’t say I have created one specifically amazing thing, but rather a lot of awesome smaller projects throughout my life. First it was Skateboards. My best friend and I decided we wanted to build a skateboard company so we started with one plank of wood and by the end of the summer, we had three impressive cruiser boards. Next, it was backpacks. I had a biking bag that I tore through from riding so much, so I decided to rip it apart and model my own backpack made of blue canvas and tan vinyl off of it, piece by piece. I borrowed my grandmother’s sewing machine 1 day later I had 2 backpacks. Then, came the bow ties. My clothing company at the time had taken a turn from standard t-shirts to men’s neckwear, so the bow tie was a natural fit. Once again, it was grandma’s sewing machine, and within a few days I had 5 legit ties. 

Although every project was different, especially with respect to materials, the learning process was always the same. Dive in, screw up, learn, perfect.
column52: Manchester United fan, Stock Market Investor, and Number Cruncher

column59:
When I was in fifth grade we had to give a speech on a topic that we were interested in. I decided to talk about the Bulls and the Bears. When I first started off, most of the kids though I was talking about Chicago sports. However, I was actually talking about the stock market and describing what a bull versus bear market was. Everyone was shocked. They had never really even thought of the stock market.

I’ve had a passion for numbers my entire life. When I was 11 years old, I decided to invest in the stock market. With a small seed investment from my grandpa, I had started buying my first shares in companies. Since then, I’ve been building financial models and stock criteria screening. One of the benefits of investing over a long period of time is the ability to compound your growth. Throughout the last 14 years of investing, I’ve been able to achieve great things. Knowing how to read financial statements, develop models, and analyze moats is a very beneficial thing to have.

column10: An app that answers the "You've got cancer. Now what?" question
column39: I am a physician who is an expert and leader in integrative medicine.
column52: I am a creative and energetic software developer and team leader.
column182: AntiCancerMe develops dietary advice, exercise plans, and stress management tools tailored to meet the unique needs of cancer patients.
column183:
Integrative medicine gives cancer patients and survivors alike the tools to proactively improve their lives, from physical health to mental well-being. By fostering positive changes in diet, physical activity and stress management, our approach strategically complements conventional cancer treatment. 
Currently, there is no technology available to address the aforementioned needs, nor is there a solution designed to properly equip the average person in their personal fight against cancer. The products that do exist are generic, static, and overwhelm users with information.
Our app, AntiCancerMe, provides dynamic, authoritative information — including dietary advice, exercise plans, and stress management tools — specifically tailored to the individual user.
Unlike other generic health fitness apps, AntiCancerMe only caters to people affected by cancer. All too often these individuals, in their quest for improved health, find themselves mired in the excess of information (and misinformation) available on the internet. AntiCancerMe delivers appropriate, customized information to the user at exactly the right time of day, based on the user’s particular situation. A team led by expert in integrative medicine curates the information effectively leaving the user with a virtual integrative medicine doctor.

Ultimately, we want to grow the team, build better business partnerships, increase our customer base and secure supplemental capital.

column182: 5S is an idea foundry that aggregates custom software and hardware to serve ignored markets of existing firms.
column183:
5S will take off-the-shelf hardware and pair it with custom software to solve limitations in current solutions or identify unmet market segments. Because of the extensive talents of the founders and advisory board members we do not commit ourselves to any one industry or silo of interest. We look for fun problems to solve and search globally for tools that when combined with IP provide the solutions. 
The founders and advisors bring such a wide range of experience that unique solutions are manifested readily. Many problems are identified and solved but only those that can be satisfactorily monetized are pursued. The team has an extensive network of experts who can identify or provide the aggregation tools required. 
For our first project we have created a new sports fantasy site that focuses an being a fan of sports instead of an analyzer of individual players. Our second project involves teen driving and cell phone use. Our third project is optimizing real-time visualization of business intelligence.  
5S is attempting to capture the dynamics of Thomas Edison's original laboratory. When he found interesting problems he led his team to explore a myriad of potential solutions but only bringing to market those that produced significant income. However he was inventor of products that created industries and monopolies; 5S is an innovator in identifying the true desires of the market segment that is underserved.

Our vision is to create a world full of meaningful content, forming into experiences for users according to the place, time and context they're in. To enable that we need a lot of rich, tagged, location-based content, and a well defined user-base.
So we created a Location Based Learning platform, with various applications in different contexts, enabling experiential, meaningful & authentic learning. We have many products using our system, targeting municipalities, organizations, museums, schools etc. enabling the creation and/or organization of location-based-learning objects and experiences. So in essence, what we're creating is an API, which we use in the applications that were created by us so far, and that will be open in the future for external uses too.
We have a lot of use of our system and products in Israel, and plan to expand globally. This strategy allows us to create revenue, while expanding our content and user base, in order to realize our vision one step at a time.

column10: We wirelessly charge devices at the places and moments you need them most.
column16:
How often have you used mobile GPS as you head to an important meeting with no extra time to spare and just as you're about to make the next turn, your phone died? How often were you in the middle of an important conversation with a boss, a friend, or a spouse, and again your phone died?

Our phones often die at the most inopportune places at the most inconvenient times, but there are no great alternatives for consumers to turn to today.

There are wired chargers, inductive charging pads, crowd solution products, and external battery packs. Inductive charging pads are thin matt-like objects that charge an electronic device only when placed directly on the pad. Crowd solution products being developed aim to be similar to WiFi but for power within a small office or room. Lastly, external battery packs are portable high capacity batteries.

Inductive charging pads and crowd solution products offer more power at inconvenient times, but not necessarily inopportune places because their systems rely on an outlet to function. Thus, these products are implemented in places where we normally still have access to power. This almost makes 'wireless charging' seem like an oxymoron since the products require a wire to use. Meanwhile, external battery packs are almost the opposite. External battery packs offer consumers more power at inopportune places or areas where consumers don't have readily access to power, but not necessarily inconvenient times. This is because the physical connection between the external battery pack and the electronic device can be cumbersome while on the move or we simply forget the battery state of our device due to multitasking.

Our product called the MotherBox is the first device that can babysit your phone for you! It has a rechargeable battery so it can offer additional power in a similar fashion to external battery packs, and it also has the ability to provide wireless power-on-demand! The MotherBox can sense the battery level of your device, turn itself on when needed, and wirelessly charge your device during use. For example, the next time you're in the middle of that important conversation and your battery drops from 10% to 5% the MotherBox can sense that change and begin seamlessly charging it. The user can then customize his or her experience via the mobile application.
column17: We wirelessly charge electronic devices as they move freely at the moments and places you need them most.

column46:
Academic Achievements:

I graduated magna cum laude from University at Buffalo in three years with a B.S. in Finance, accolades from the Advanced Honors Program, and a 3.7 GPA. I graduated from Binghamton University a year later with an MBA with a Concentration in Business Analytics and Finance and a 3.8 GPA, making me the youngest graduate in the class and one of the youngest ever in the program.

General Accomplishments:

When I was eighteen, I wrote a screenplay called Crash of 29, and engaged in a contract with an Emmy-nominated producer for it. Last year, I invented a new financial product for investment banks called GBFs that entwines derivatives to money market funds in a new way. Furthermore, although my degrees are not in engineering, I have taught myself a great deal of electrical and software engineering, and consider myself experienced in high frequency power electronics and Objective-C. I’m an inventor at heart, and enjoy the challenge of creating the new and unexpected.
column182: We safely, efficiently, and effectively wirelessly charge electronic devices, such as smartphones and tablets, while in motion.
column183:
We develop hardware architecture and communication systems that can safely and efficiently wirelessly charge electronic devices, such as smartphones and tablets, as they move freely. Our systems leverage resonant inductive technology, a highly efficient and safe wireless power transfer medium, in unique ways that allow us to overcome many challenges facing today's wireless charging systems.

Although resonant inductive technology allows slight misalignment of coils, it is still sensitive to the angular alignment between them. If the angle between your device and the wireless charging product is misaligned, your device may not charge well or at all. Furthermore, resonant inductive technology has difficulty charging multiple devices simultaneously if the transmitter coil isn't much larger than the receiving coil. Because few people would like to wrap a coil around their house and pay an electric bill equivalent to operating a power plant, this presents some additional problems.

With our first product called the MotherBox, we solve these major limitations. The MotherBox is a 4” x 4” portable wireless charging platform that is capable of charging devices within 1½’ to 2’ radius. With our unique coil geometry, the MotherBox is capable of enduring great coil misalignment, and with our communication system, we prevent magnetic distortion from multiple resonating receivers. For the first time, you can charge your phone as you walk to class, go to work, or kick back at your desk!

column195: Today's wireless charging products are almost all completely reliant on an outlet, and out of those that are moveable, none have a means of recharging itself wirelessly. This makes current "wireless" charging seem like an oxymoron since the product still requires a wire to use. The MotherBox is incredibly unique because it can wirelessly recharge with its solar cells and kinetic energy recharging accessories. Thus, you may never need to plug in your phone again and the wireless charging product!
column196: Our main competitors are experienced wireless charging firms that focus on mid-range wireless power transfer for consumer electronic solutions, such as WiTricity (http://witricity.com/) and Energous (http://energous.com/). However, these firms mainly apply their technology to home and office solutions, which have some serious drawbacks. The systems they are developing are completely reliant on outlet, can be enormous, potentially complex and expensive to install, and demolish your electric bill.
column197: We are open to manufacturing products on our own, entering a joint venture with an experienced manufacturer, or licensing our products to third parties. However, we are currently most inclined to enter a joint development agreement for the manufacturing of the MotherBox and license our transmitter design to auto manufacturers. For the MotherBox and the auto system, we would primarily obtain revenue streams from product sales, advertisement ads, and licensing fees.
column198: Our user base is predicated on the licensing, sale, and marketing of the MotherBox and vehicle systems. For the MotherBox, we have outlined a detailed marketing plan for the next three years. We will predominantly target two consumer segments called Young Traveling Businessmen and High School & College Students due to their accessibility, profitability, and the positioning of the product in their minds. We would be more than happy to share with you our market research.
column200: We have completed our first proof-of-concept prototype called the MotherBox for the consumer electronics segment, and are currently installing an upgraded communication system that allows immense user control and safety functionality. The entire foundation of the MotherBox application has already been completed along with the transmitter circuitry.
column201: Our next milestone is the completion of our communication system upgrade, which can be considered beta-level software. Our communication system is by far the most sophisticated ever made for wireless charging platform in order to offer consumers advanced control and safety. For example, we can conduct real-time temperature monitoring and create recommended charging periods to prevent overheating and overcharging of users' devices. The real-time temperature monitoring is crucial because many wireless charging products experience overheating issues when charging different devices or brands of devices. The recommended charging periods is very important because many users unintentionally diminish the useful battery life of their devices by charging them overnight. The recommended charging period would turn off the MotherBox when you're sleeping and your battery is near maximum capacity. We expect to finish the entire upgrade by the end of November, and are very excited about its potential.

With an external investment of at least four hundred thousand dollars, we are confident that we can have a market-ready model in less than a year. With an external investment of at least one million three hundred thousand dollars, we are confident that we can manufacture the MotherBox ourselves. We will be attempting to raise funds in several months.

column195: Our company has three goals: create a unified location for parties and events; become THE social network for parties and events; and to stop bullying. My competitors don't understand the needs of my target demographic; app-focused, a party/event-dedicated service,and a beautiful minimalism design. And unlike our competitors we directly care about our users; we want build the social skills needed by our users in order for them to make friends and prevent bullying.
column196: My competitors are Facebook, Meetup, and Eventbrite. The biggest one I fear is Meetup because it's service is dedicated to events. Though both are pretty weak as competitors since they don't fully understand what my users(13 - 29) want; especially Eventbrite since it's more of a recommendation service, instead of a social network environment.
column197: Nexrave will make money from affiliation, data mining, and selling spots(their events) at the top of a user's timeline in that area. In year 1, we will make money by mining useful data, such as what times of year do parties occur most; and sell it to big data-collecting companies or directly to the companies it matter most to. In year 2 we will introduce selling the event/party spot at the top of our users' news feed.

column10: Product designer, software developer, UI/UX pontificator
column182: We create innovative and engaging photographic experiences for photography professionals and brands seeking deeper customer involvement.
column183:
We created an award-winning app called Pocketbooth that simulates the experience of sitting in a vintage photobooth. Apple highlighted it as one of their year-end best-of apps and Starbucks selected it as one of their free apps of the week. Crate & Barrel also featured it as an app giveaway in their Spring catalog. It has been downloaded over a million times since its introduction in 2010.

This past year we began developing and selling a B2B iPad app called Pocketbooth Promo. Pocketbooth Promo enables companies to deploy branded photographic experiences either as kiosks or in brand ambassador assisted scenarios. The platform that underpins this app allows us to customize, deploy, and monitor these apps from a central web-based backend. Clients can opt to use the lead generation component of the app to gather and engage new customers and a rich analytics component allows the company to see how their customers are using and sharing the photos.

There are two related products we are working on.

The first is Pocketbooth Party -- it is a consumer-facing offering targeted at individuals who would like to have their own photobooth at a party or event but cannot afford a physical photobooth which can cost over a thousand dollars. This app will ship by year's end. 

The second is Pocketbooth Vend, an iPad-based kiosk available for bars, restaurants, museums, and 
theme parks that replaces the traditional photobooth with a modern and customizable photo vending machine.

column182: We transform vacant spaces into interactive, dynamic displays to generate visual impact, cross-promotional opportunities, leads and revenue.
column183: We will offer a multi-sided platform which will enable two distinct revenue streams and entry into a new and unique wearable technology product family. Our SHOWCloud offering will be promoted to businesses that need to display expanded product content in limited space at customer events.  SHOWCloud is a cloud-based display application built on our existing MobExMe®  platform that blends marketing automation, video, social media and lead capture into a display as a service platform - Displays as a Service Experience (DaaSx).  Our CashFlow Cloud applications allow businesses to transform vacant spaces into interactive and dynamic visual displays that generate exposure, impact and revenue for their products and/or services.   Through partner channels we provide enclosures and stands to support tablets, notebooks and other display devices and dongles.  Our entry into wearable tech will include innovations in display material produced through a disruptive printing processes called printed electronics.  Flexible, paper-thin display material (substrates) will soon replace traditional LCD panel displays.   We plan to leverage early flexible displays as material that can be woven into clothing, pop-up displays, banners and other forms of digital signage.   Disruptive displays leveraged with our display as a service will create new markets and opportunities in existing and new multi-billion dollar industries.  We are partnering with T-REX startups to create new wearable tech channels.

I started programming at the age of 12.
At the age of 16, I launched my first company “NEXUSHOLDING” (http://www.nexus-holding.com/, 2009-2011) which offered digital services (graphic design, web design & web development). This company served around 6 charities through 10 products and 16 small businesses through 40 products.
At the age of 18, I launched my first startup, alongside a few partners, named “Collegels” (as in College List, http://collegels.com, 2011-2013) which is a CommonApp-like web app for the Middle-East through which we successfully got agreements with more than 5 of the top schools and had a positively growing 10-months relationship with the top 2 universities in the Middle-East before some of our partners postponed their work in the project because of time and other constraints. In this project, we were backed by one of the biggest software companies in the MENA region (BMB Group, http://bmbgroup.com).
I am still learning and practicing new skills until now.
column182: A small computer that can project Windows on a table as a touchscreen and open the same OS on any computer when you connect the device to it
column183:
A pocket-sized device that can stand on a plane surface and project Windows with touchscreen functionality on that surface.
When connected to any computer, the user can run Windows on that computer using the computer's processor power, mouse and keyboard with the user's own files and programs while the device is charging.

For the "new" and "interesting" part, the small sized computer, the projection and finger manipulation will do.
Other companies are now coming up with pocket (or small) sized computers but until now, they all have the same problem which is the fact that you have to plug a screen, a mouse and a keyboard to make it work and that will be a problem when you take it with you. We have a much simpler approach, just plug it to any computer using a USB cable or project and work on a table.

column182: FundWok is an innovative online social community where resources are located and shared effectively and ideas and initiatives supported.
column183:
Currently, FundWok  serves as a platform for people who have funds to give or buy services for to make them available and specify the amount and the criteria.

The long-term goal of FundWok is to promote free economy, so more features will be provided to enable easier exchange of resources between people. These include enable the 'funder' to give away services (which they can ask for something in return just like now), more payment options (currently it's just Paypal), and more versatile filters to be able to locate funds easier.
column185:
What we hope to gain from the program is to lay grounds for FundWok to a few levels:
1. Infrastructure: While the intention is not to be comprehensive, we look for advice in terms of a manageable framework for startups at an early stage.
2. Network: We wanted to know if the investors are excited by this idea, and how to pitch FundWok effectively to the startup community which might needs to be different from the customers hear. We also wanted to discover FundWok's potential from peers.
column186: Sonia Lin, Founder and CEO, is leading the tech development of FundWok as well as the operations.
column188:
Yes.
Sonia previously co-founded a Chicago-based startup Kauzu, which was a location-based job search platform. Kauzu won the top prize of Gigabit Challenge, a Google-themed business competition held in Kansas City. Sonia went on raising the profile of the startup to international visibility, and was featured in a Google commercial along with the startup regarding the founding of Kauzu.
column190: n/a
column193: The two employees work as part-time consultants, one based in Chicago, and the other based in Mumbai. The team of three has been working remotely for 6 months with steady progress.
column195: Fundwok’s unique angle is that it gives funders the freedom to choose how much to give and what conditions to set to giving without any commitments. While sites like Groupon or Living Social help in business promotion, you need to sign up for monthly commitments, offer a large inventory and give a big commission. Fundwok doesn’t impose any of that. You can choose to spend thousands or just a few dollars. You can choose to fund hundreds of potential clients, or just the right one.
column196: There are other online sites where businesses or individuals can purchases tangible goods or services, like Craigslist (craigslist.com), but that site leaves a lot to be desired. Craigslist charges for a businesses to list a job ad, while Fundwok doesn’t. Craiglist provides the funder’s e-mail address and phone number, and allows individuals to contact the funder. Fundwok requires both the funder and those that want to be funded to register for accounts and list their identifying information.
column197:
10% commission is charged on top of each transaction (whenever the funder selects the applicant). 
The current target is individuals and small business owners who are looking to hire help, encourage initiatives, or like exploring/sharing great deals.
column198: Currently we find them through online market place such as fiverr.com which is a good microcosm of our target audience -- who have diverse needs either with business or gifting, and want to do it with an affordable and efficient way without commitment.
column200: The metric we're looking at now is how much it costs to acquire customers, how often do the customers come back, and how long their lifecycle is on the website.
column201: The next milestone of FundWok would be revenue-positive, which is planned be reached in 6 months.

column182: Enabling clear communication between entrepreneurs and investors so both sides never miss an investment opportunity
column183:
Startups and investors have a challenging relationship - both sides miss great opportunities because of unclear communication. invisu aims to solve this by creating simple yet elegant communication and a relationship management solution for startups and investors.

The first layer of our product, the invisu One Pager wizard, aims to solve the first step in communication - the one pager sent out before the first meeting.  invisu automatically guides startups to create a beautiful, visual, dynamic and responsive one pager with a unique link sent to each investor separately so they can track the engagement.  Invisu is currently the only tool that is a creator of dynamic one-pagers for start ups, giving them a guided, simple user experience with a striking output.  As we progress we will become a sophisticated mobile tool for investors to seek and track quality investments, all in one place.

We've created a set of small blocks that can be used to create almost any automation gadget, in 5 minutes, by non-technical user.

What makes us unique is our target audience. We're targeting common, non-technical users that don't know how to write a line of code. We've created a product that's very easy to use, can't be broken by experimenting, and has built in testing and learning functionality. The one thing we don't compromise on is "ease of use".

column182: Disrupting market for custom electronic devices, by allowing the average person to build whatever they want on their own.
column183:
We're creating small electronic blocks that can be connected like Lego bricks to build complex custom electronic devices in a few minutes. It's easy-to-use, foolproof design that allows the users to build themselves whatever they want, fast and cheap.
We're closing the gap between what few engineering can do in 5 months, and what average consumer can do in 5 minutes.

ELFblocks (ELF = ELectronic Feedback) can be used for home/industrial automation, smarting-up existing devices, environment control, custom security/alarm system, etc., and can be connected to your smartphone, to the internet (to create custom IoT devices), and easily integrated with existing electronic devices.
Each block contains small computer and works on it's own (and costs us on average $4.9644 per block, using parts from eBay).
We believe anyone can build whatever he needs, once they have pieces they know how to build with. If someone can define what he wants, he should also be able to create that, all other irrelevant details should not be getting in the way.
We've finished the prototype and made a lot of demo videos on ELFblocks.com.

column16: BeMobyle is a mobile platform and a web-based application that allows travelers from all over the world to have unlimited phone calls and iInternet connection, as well as various features that each hotel can customize to their clients in order to improve both experience and quality of their stay.

column182: BeMobyle is a platform for mobile and web-based application that allows travelers from all over the world to imrpove their stay.
column183: BeMobyle represents an innovative and versatile tool, with the aim to improve the travel experience for millions of tourists. We speak directly to the hotels, giving to its customers a useful and desired service through a simple mobile device. BeMobyle consists of two distinct parts, namely an Android smartphone (with a specific application) and a web-based platform that integrates complementary measures to create an innovative and currently non-existent device. The mobile application allows the user to manage and dispose of all the features of an ordinary phone (communication, entertainment, multimedia, etc) including unlimited phone calls, messages and internet browsing. In this way the user can use our smartphone to keep in touch with their families, to manage its business, to have fun and spend every moment of his trip abroad, without worrying about the high costs of the regular services. In addition, the user can take advantage of special deals and others commercial opportunities.

column182: Zet Universe is a visual dashboard that integrates project information for PMs struggling with too many projects
column183:
Project Managers have to be in control of their projects; existing software stores information in separate silos, so projects live only in PMs’ heads. Forgetting things leads to cascade failures within PMs’ organizations. To avoid that, PMs spend about 4 hours a day to get the most current project status, but failures still happen. Zet Universe allows PMs to keep track of their project information.

Zet Universe is in many ways unique as it allows customers to continue using services they use instead of switching to another project management solution (which is usually offered in these cases). Zet Universe by its nature is similar to Google as smart indexer that builds knowledge graph of users' projects, and similar to Palantir Workspace as it allows users to connect and visualize data sources to organize data by projects.

From user perspective, Zet Universe is a visual dashboard. It shows all project information from various sources in one place. Zet Universe provides a combination of intuitive visual metaphor, familiar manually and automatically extracted IF-THIS-THAN-THAT (IFTTT-like) rules, and semantic extraction to define project information boundaries. Those boundaries are used to automatically classify incoming information by user's projects.

Visual dashboard provides users with ability to see a high level view of their projects, as well as to quickly zoom into each project's details when needed.

column10: 25 years of experience in Environmental, Chemical and Analytical Research
column182: Develop agricultural product for the herd animal industry
column183: We are developing an innovative product we call the "Goat Shoe" for long-term prevention of Footrot. This product will replace the centuries old "trough" method that is time consuming, ineffective, and must be repeated on a very frequent scheduling. Our product, which is in the development stage, can be applied in seconds, will last for months, uses an environmentally friendly bactericide that does not harm the goat nor the coat of the animal. We plan to product about 100 prototypes of our product in the lab, and work with Lincoln University, a Missouri HBCU, to test the product for 6 months. Lincoln has a small ruminants research group. Then we plan to seek out a third party to produce about 5000 of the Adjusted phase two prototype and seek out partnerships in the industry interested in testing the product under actual field conditions. The product will simultaneously be tested in the lab under a number of soil acidity, weatherization, temperature and

Allen Jr. has four years research experience working with small ruminants and has the isolated DRB1 second exon in goat species, registry NCBI accession#: KM196595.

column16:
CTY's flagship product is Numina. Numina provides analytics for places, starting with a completely plug-and-play device that can count anything you can see. Get real-time counts of pedestrians, bicycles, strollers, wheelchairs, and other special objects. Where traditionally people had to observe conditions on-site, Numina can now provide complete situational awareness, for anywhere, from anywhere, in real time.

column182: "Automated Shutterfly" for destinations with targeted advertising in 72-page photobooks in less than 5 minutes
column183:
Books, Software & Hardware

We sell photobooks with ad placements to tourists on high emotion trips.

We're faster with higher quality. 

We increase traffic to destination gift shops when customers pick up the book.

We incorporate trivia into a scavenger hunt application that is completed with photographs, thus curating them.

We make software for the mobile applications and order processing to build the books from customer photographs.

We make the "print stations" that store the material, printers, backup power, assembly unit and computer in a 2' x 4' footprint. (2 printers). One std pallet stores 1600 books and is easy to operate. We created a book in 5 minutes. Faster printer will bring that down to 2. Print stations can be installed like legos - museums, cruise ships, etc.

Print stations do not require a photo lab and have no special power or environmental requirements.

Desire for scavenger hunt "completionism" increases per capital revenue for destinations by strategically creating a scavenger hunt path with a desirable vistor pathway. Example: Sending a visitor to the planetarium side of the St Louis Science Center increases per cap revenue by as much as $10.

The print station is the core. Each component of our system is "loosely coupled." For example can integrate with other photo applications. We will store the photographs, have the customer account and manage the ad buys. The ad algorithm is setup with vision to integrate w/ Google AdWords type services.

Mark: S. African import business from $0 to $1mm in less than 1 year. Also working on Eco-friendly and GREEN solutions for paving roads both in the US and internationally. Works w/ the Heritage Research Group Lab.

column195:
Speed, quality, content and focus. 

We put travel-sized books in customer's hands before they leave the destination. 

We cut the elapsed time from a memorable experience to receiving a book from weeks to minutes.

Our algorithm dynamically creates content based on photo metadata. 

We provide value to destinations by increasing time on site and more traffic to gift shop therefor increasing per capita revenue.

We are working on a worldwide exclusive for the travel-sized cover technology.

The objector is not our customer. We focus on tourists, not locals, and admittedly STLSC doesn't have high emotional value. We also now produce a 4x6 travel size.)

Books lend themselves to gifts, furthering our reach.

column201:
Three Big Ones: Exclusivity, Patent and Pilot. 

Exclusivity: We are currently negotiating a worldwide exclusive on travel-sized form factor of the new cover technology. That's key. Next meeting is 11/20/14.

Patent: Our IP attorney indicates 2 elements of our system might be patentable. Application is underway and we have a notorized product description. 

Pilot: Working with a destination in Austin, TX to pilot book sales. They're independent which avoids the "blocker" we experienced with the science center (Wildlife Trading Company has a photo concession exclusive) and allows us to move quickly. They feature dinosaurs which has high impulse buy value for little kids. They do field trips and family visits. Planning underway, expect to start early December 2014.
column208:
We look forward to your wisdom on this matter but here's our thinking. 

$1 million ASAP to augment team, commercialize products, negotiate long-term exclusive contracts with customers and for the technology - that's runway through end of January. Double that for 6 months.

Then $5mm+ to scale in Q2. Subsequent investment will depend upon amount of inventory we need to establish. 

We want to be a major player for the "high season" in Sept.

Enough money to launch this rocket ship and get to market and be a major player quickly. 

We want to partner with companies who have existing supply chain and destination contracts. Our product has to be rock-solid before we approach them so we're in a strong negotiating position.

column10: Co-Founder, Invisible Girlfriend and Invisible Boyfriend
column182: We help alleviate social and familial pressure singles feel when judged by others by giving them a better and more believable story to tell.
column183: Our service (currently in private beta) gives our users real-world and virtual proof that they’re in a relationship, even if they’re not.  This proof includes real-time, on-demand text message conversations, voicemails, handwritten notes, gifts and flowers.  While there are a number of reasons our customers are using the service (family pressure to date, unwelcome harassment at work, loneliness, desire to make exes jealous, sexual orientation hidden from others, etc.), all desire to live life on their own terms. We help them do so, free from the judgment or disapproval they’ve received from others.
column185: In our beta, we are validating our subscription-based business model with paying customers, while optimizing user acquisition strategies for the US market. Because of the significant international interest (we have over 9,000 international email subscribers for Invisible Girlfriend alone), we wish to focus on serving the international market as soon as possible. We will also explore partnership opportunities with dating services, gift and flower delivery services, and others.

column190: Kyle Tabor has been working full time for almost six months now. Others will move to more time as we begin raising funds.
column195: We’ve developed a technological solution to a real problem suffered by a generally marginalized global population. Many in this category don’t want (or need) to date, choosing instead to focus on their career or living life on their own terms. Having identified this global need, Invisible Girlfriend and Invisible Boyfriend deliver believable, affordable real-world and virtual social proof to these individuals. We're different because we treat our users with respect and do so in a respectful way.
column196: We are unaware of any viable competition for Invisible Boyfriend. There are a few companies who provide “fake” girlfriends: Fakegirlfriend.co and fakeinternetgirlfriend.com are two companies who profess to deliver a digital relationship solution. These companies have exhibited no traction to date. Others like Tabao.com in China or Loueunepetiteamie.com in France offer to “rent” girlfriends.
column197: We charge our customers a monthly subscription fee to interact with their “Invisible” partner through a set amount of voicemails, text messages, notes, etc. They incur additional charges for extra messages and more expensive items like gifts and flowers. Some of our customers use our service to create a believable “cover” for disapproving-of-LGBT-lifestyles friends or family. Others wish to avoid harassment in the workplace from fellow employees or superiors.
column198: Since launching our private beta in November 2014, we’ve been slowly adding paying users from a list of 4,500 who’ve signed up for the Invisible Girlfriend beta. We’ve had over 15,000 unique potential customers sign up for our newsletter. More sustainable marketing efforts include specifically-targeted advertising campaigns on social sites like Facebook and the use of Google AdWords. We've also received international media attention from publications like Buzzfeed, Time, Wired, and The Guardian.
column200: We’ve recently launched a private beta program in order to validate our subscription business model and customer value proposition. We are currently limiting access to a small subset of the over 4,500 people who have applied. We plan on inviting cohorts of 50 users each week to test price sensitivity versus feature sets before a public launch in December 2014.
column201: Our next milestone is the launching of our site to the public in December 2014. We expect to have 1,000 paying users generating $20,000 in monthly recurring revenue by early 2015.
column208: We need at least $250k to hire a development team to take our product out of beta and for customer acquisition. By July 2015, we plan to begin international expansion.
column209: Our greatest challenge has been not getting our product into users hands fast enough. The overwhelming media coverage has created a demand for a product that didn’t even exist until October 2014. Early testing of our prototype has show promising results. However, human capital in the design and technical realms is still our current bottleneck. We’ve got a great team in place now, but a few more hands on deck to help push along what we’re doing would be a much needed catalyst to help move Invisible Girlfriend and Invisible Boyfriend to the next level.

column182: BitCalm is server backup software as a service. It helps SMBs that have data and don't have sysadmin configure backup easily by 55 seconds.
column183:
BitCalm allows non-experts to configure backups for their servers.
In the basis of the service is the principle of fully-automated backup configuration. Our service is based on the multimodule agent software, that our users installing on their servers.
BitCalm web interface allows users to manage backup settings and monitoring backup logs and statistics.
Incremental backups significantly reduce the size of backup (save 40-70% depending on the type of data). Operating with information in RAM allows us to make compression and encryption of server data really fast and with low load on server.
Our presentation: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Uv5DUSW5etVhITuZV18fkKMpC4gjLoizsKgCU0KDu7E/edit?usp=sharing

column196:
Enterprise solutions – are user-unfriendly and are pretty expensive for the targeted segment.

Our direct competitors: https://www.backuprun.com/en and http://gobitcan.com

column10: Digital concierge for sporting goods consumers (TripAdvisor for athletes).
column16:
We're building Tackl, a media website, athletic product curation tool, and gear-focused community focused on guiding athletes to better performance footwear and equipment.

Athletic consumers are still reluctant to make purchases online, but in-store sales are largely supported by unqualified store associates, which leaves consumers in the dark. We produce engaging product-focused content (including a real-time database showing product usage among professional athletes), and we have built an advanced database and digital concierge that will give athletes accurate, data-driven product recommendations, based on verified product attributes and reviews submitted by experts and community members.

In many ways, we're also the TripAdvisor for athletic footwear and equipment. We are the first company to provide aggregated price and feedback data specifically for sporting goods consumers. We've engaged the product blogger community to aggregate reviews for every product in our database, and we have the capability to semantically analyze all of this feedback data to give consumers a concise snapshot of public sentiment on a specific product. We're also starting to produce high resolution product photography and HD video product overviews to give athletes the information they need before making a purchase.

Tackl is the athlete's ultimate roadmap of the sporting goods industry. We're seeking to engage and empower sporting goods consumers through transparency, and access to superior curation and discovery technology, which will lead to better purchases and performance.
column17: We're focused on generating engagement and buzz about athletic products by presenting an unbiased, data-driven viewpoint.

column72: I architected the wireframes and executed the launch of tackl.com, dubbed by users as the "yelp/kayak" for athletic products. Tackl surpassed 800k unique users and 55k social media followers through an eight month span post-public launch. I raised 200k for proof of concept.
column182: We have developed the world's first retail sporting goods aggregator, designed to make product search and curation easier than ever.
column183:
We have created Tackl.com, the world’s first retail sporting goods aggregator. The initial version of our platform includes the following key components: a "universal" database of sporting goods - including footwear, apparel, and equipment - segmented by sport; consumer feedback (review) and social media aggregation, a real-time product usage map (for relevant sport categories); and some basic social and user-generated content publishing features.

For too long, consumers have been forced to tediously search through countless retail domains in order to curate, research, and price compare the products they use in their athletic pursuits. The mission of Tackl.com is to deliver maximum transparency and user experience to sporting goods consumers, resulting in better informed purchase decisions and greater engagement levels for all stakeholders.

We will centralize the entire universe of athletic products onto a single infrastructure and design features that specifically cater to the needs of a performance and style-focused athletic community. Our platform will enable users to browse and compare all available products, regardless of the brand affiliation or retail channel. Content will be rigorously quality-controlled and the platform will be highly collaborative - encouraging and incentivizing honest, unbiased, and high quality feedback and participation from a passionate community.
column184: Tackl.com. The beta version of the platform will be re-launched during the first week of December 2014, followed closely by some major navigational updates and a redesigned Product page interface that includes a new 3-tier review aggregation format.
column185: Through Capital Innovators, we hope to gain access to resources, personal relationships, and additional funding that will enable us to more aggressively pursue our short and long term traction targets. Additionally, we are keenly aware of our shortcomings, and are hoping to get valuable strategic advice that will help us to avoid mistakes and missteps often made by early-stage companies, leading to greater efficiency in our spend and optimized market fit for our products.

column195: We are developing dynamic platforms for the sporting goods industry promote transparency and encourage user engagement. We are not a retailer and we are not a sporting goods brand. Rather, we are seeking to occupy an entirely new market position in the sporting goods industry, and we believe there is great demand for an aggregation platform to enter the fold. Our mission is to provide maximum clarity to consumers in an increasingly fragmented sporting goods market.
column196: More "direct" competitors include social shopping sites like Wanelo.com and Shopcade.com, in addition to sports gear-focused content websites like WhatProsWear.com, TheLocker.com, and EquipBoard.com (EquipBoard has recently pivoted to focus solely on music equipement). Less direct competitors include large retailers like Amazon and Dicks Sporting Goods, and editorial/publishing companies like Runner's World Magazine. We do not carry inventory, and we are not content producers relying on ads.
column197: Affiliate retail commissions are the primary source of revenue. Utilizing cookies, we can receive credit for consummated product purchases that originate from our domain. We are avoiding using banner advertising on our platform, we will offer in-feed sponsored posting opportunities to stakeholders who have contributed significantly to the platform in other ways, and a number of premium engagement tools for brands and retailers - including local customer service and event widgets.
column198: Shortly after the launch of our beta platform, we will launch a strategic marketing campaign, the main aspects of which are: social media (including an industry data/analytics/infographics campaign); live event marketing (various amateur sporting events and conferences); an "elite" product tester program (similar to Amazon's Vine program); and strategic partnerships with brands, retailers, and their more prominent advocates.
