column201: We are initially launching with two specific sport categories - running and basketball, which were specifically chosen for their diversity and strategic value. We have already begun working towards our golf, lacrosse, and soccer expansions, and we hope to have launched the platform across 6 sports by the end of 2015. We have a number of traction milestones that we have set for the coming years. Our initial goal is to reach 10,000 "actively engaged" users by March 2015. We would like to have 500,000 pageviews per month by the same target date. By September of 2015, we hope to be at 10,000,000 pageviews per month, aided by our expansion into new sports, and we hope that commission revenue will be well over $100,000 by the end of 2015. We plan to aggressively approach the institutional investor market beginning in February of 2015. We have laid groundwork with numerous institutional investors already, aided by our advisors in New York, who are experienced in raising venture capital.

column10: E-commerce that features American-made products and shopping guidance
column16:
The primary goal of The Stated Home is to shift the home furnishing consumer mindset to be towards quality and craftsmanship as opposed to cheap and disposable. The Stated Home is an e-commerce website that will only offer products that are made in America which will benefit both the environment and the economy. In addition to promoting American manufacturing, we will make furniture shopping easier, more transparent and less overwhelming for consumers. The Stated Home will achieve this by offering a curated selection of quality furniture and producing content aimed at guiding the customer through selecting the best furnishings for their lifestyle and tastes.

To combat the economic and environmental impact of overseas furniture manufacturing, consumers must buy more American-made goods. We plan to promote this by effectively demonstrating why consumers should purchase these items over those produced overseas. We will feature the manufacturers through video and written content aimed at telling their story, highlighting the furniture benefits, and explaining what makes these pieces quality. By educating consumers with the stories of the manufacturers and showing where their dollars are going we will keep and grow manufacturing jobs in America.

In order to effectively sell furniture, we must make the process less overwhelming to consumers. We will accomplish this by orchestrating an online shopping experience different than any that currently exist. We will:
-Offer styles and fabrics pre-selected to be timeless yet stylish
-Produce written and video tutorials on how to determine comfort
-Clearly identify furniture and fabrics that are appropriate for specific lifestyles (kids or small spaces, for example)
-Develop new and fun ways to shop for furniture (through personality or lifestyle)
column17: More than an American-made marketplace; we are a comprehensive content creation company that answers questions and creates transparency
column23: B2C: age group 30-45 - helping with furniture purchasing decisions;

column46: I am proud of building my career and moving up the ladder to becoming at senior editor at Shape magazine. It had been my dream since college to become a magazine editor and I slowly took steps to make that happen. I went to graduate school at Northwestern University, moved to New York, got hired as an editorial assistant at Good Housekeeping, and slowly moved my way to different titles and higher positions. The day I was promoted to senior editor I knew that I had achieved what I set out to when I was 19 years old.
column52: Teacher turned designer who will change the way we shop for furniture

About two years ago, I started my first company with a partner. I built the website myself and handled all marketing, project management, and administration duties. The business became profitable, but I knew I wanted to get into a broader-reaching business with the goal of making a difference. My other achievement is a large cabinet and mantle that I designed and built. I took a course and used industrial woodworking tools to mold raw lumber into a professional piece of furniture that lives in my family room. I smile every time I look at it.
column182: The Stated Home is an e-commerce website that will make furniture shopping more transparent and less overwhelming for consumers.
column183:
The Stated Home will address three issues with the current furniture shopping environment: consumer frustration from so many choices, identifying comfort online, and promoting American craftsman.

Shopping for furniture is often overwhelming since existing furniture stores offer hundreds of different options per category of good (ie sofas). The Stated Home will offer a curated selection of furniture in versatile styles from only the best manufacturers. There will be written and video content to highlight the benefits of our offerings as well as tutorials on how to figure out the best style and fabric for the customer.

Consumers don’t know what to consider when looking for comfortable furniture and comfort is impossible to determine when shopping online. We will create a comfort rating system and a series of written and video tutorials to explain what to think about when determining if a piece of furniture will be comfortable. In addition, individual furniture styles will have videos of comfort “testers” sitting on and talking about how the piece feels to further eliminate this barrier to online furniture shopping.

There is no centralized source for consumers to find stylish, high- quality American-made household goods. I will identify American manufacturers that offer on-trend furniture styles.

column182: VeriQuik is a risk mitigation platform where users can quickly establish, authentic, and verify their own or someone else's identity.
column183:
VeriQuik is a proactive platform where users can quickly establish, authentic, validate, and verify their identity; or send a request to someone else so they can verify themselves, prior to meeting for the first time.

- Charles Oliver was charged with 3 counts of sexual assault, 3 counts of unlawful restraint and 1 count of harassment of a witness in Woodstock, Illinois. He met 6 different victims on Craigslist.

- Dr. Thomas Brey was sentenced to 25 years for rape, sodomy, strangulation and the assault of Jennifer Bennett in Bend, Oregon. They met on Match.com, and he had a previous charge of sexual assault.

Unfortunately, these are just 2 of countless stories of horrific acts of violence and other criminal activity perpetrated upon unsuspecting victims; in which the victim met the attacker via the Internet. Human beings innately recognize their basic need for safety and personal security, but with the advent of the Internet, we have largely sacrificed this most basic need for the sake of
speed and convenience.

With VeriQuik's quikIQ technology and QuikScreen process, we allow users a measurable tool to mitigate risk before meeting someone for the first time. For pre-employment screening needs, our automated system via API easily integrates into any users existing site or HRIS system.

The Kansas City startup community has labeled VeriQuik as the "Carfax for People"!

We also hope to share our passion for making new, & spending time with family and friends

VeriQuik solves the unknown for our customers, & takes the guesswork out of meeting someone for the first time.

Unfortunately background checks can be costly for employers, or sites like LinkedIn and Match.com. It's not always feasible and cost effective for them to conduct screens on their users. With VeriQuik it is! VeriQuik can easily be integrated into ANY system, and background checks can be quickly conducted.

VeriQuik solves the unknown for our customers, and takes out the guesswork!
column196:
VeriQuik hopes to be the background screening authority for the dating and sharing economy.

Our competition is: www.beenverified.com and www.instantcheckmate.com

Although....

Unlike those sites that access public record data dumps, VeriQuik performs REAL voluntary background checks. Due to legal and regulatory compliance, this is the only true way to complete a criminal history check. Our permission-based model allows the end user to be the gatekeeper of his or her own information.

With decades of combined law enforcement, personal safety and security experience, we possess the passion to doggedly pursue the preservation of human life. column182: We are an online marketplace for fun & affordable in-person classes in the community.
column183:
Dabble was conceived after we struggled on our own with trying, learning and doing new things as adults. We knew that like us, lots of people have a “bucket list” of interests they’re interested in pursuing (everything from brewing beer to learning guitar). Typical classes offered, however, require a significant commitment of time or money and thus aren’t always attractive to folks with busy lives, families, and careers.

Dabble exists at the intersection of education and entertainment: an alternative to a night out, a way of meeting new people, all while expanding one’s horizons and learning something new. The educational landscape today is fragmented. Dabble’s competitive advantage is in our focus on moving casual education offline. The beauty of learning alongside and from like-minded individuals in one’s community is an entirely different experience.

Dabble attracts people with a lifelong learning mentality - those who are interested in expanding their mind, cultivating experiences and relationships and exploring new horizons. Our experience and data since launching in 2011 shows the growth opportunity is significant.

With much of learning moving online, Dabble's secret sauce is our focus on in-person learning in the community.

Second, we'll be selling IPTV with an a la carte subscription service (NBC, ABC, CBS, HBO, etc...) plus you'll have all the apps from the Google Play such as Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, YouTube, Vudu, etc... Fourth, with IPTV we'll be able to sell 3rd party ads/commercials to overlap commercials consumers opt out of and feed that information back to companies that are paying for broadcast commercials. Fifth, we'll be able to sell companies analytics on what shows consumers watch across cable TV and Video on Demand (ex. Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, YouTube, Vudu, etc...). column183: The problem we are solving is app monetization for developers through premium app experience to consumers. Fairket offers a unique 'Rent To Own' model, where consumers are charged strictly on a usage based and get to own an app after sustained usage. Rental charges for all apps are deducted from a prepaid credit balance, which consumer can top up either with hard money or ad funded free credits. Developers unlock revenue potential by offering premium app experience at compelling usage pricing. Fairket app is an App Rental Market, where consumers can discover all rentable apps in one place.

column182: Helps users create and store life story questions/answers using a tablet.
column183:
There are many ways of creating a life story and many of them focus on compiling pictures, written stories, video clips, etc. Many of these methods focus on quality of the content making the life story process a painful one. These methods are typically done by one or two people contracted by a family at a cost over $1,000. These methods take editing and production skills and take a lot of time. Also, this process doesn't necessarily include people outside of the production team. Granvu is a social media app that allows an older loved one to answer one question at a time through a tablet making the software a self editor. The app also encourages friends and family to ask questions and start a dialogue with older loved ones. The system has built-in questions that a user can answer or ask and also allows the users to enter their own questions. Overall, Granvu is an easy way to answer life's most important questions and save them for future generations.  

There are benefits to a seniors' housing company for using Granvu as well. Staff can ask residents a question to get to better know them which will create good will among staff, residents and family. Also, a facility can promote Granvu in their marketing to let prospective families know that they do make an attempt to get to know the residents and the familes will see proof on Granvu.

column195: It will truly make the world a better place by helping over 50 users connect with their children, grandchildren and friends and leave something that will be cherished for generations. It is also a great activity while visiting grandma.
column196:
lifebio.com & liveon.com 
Lifebio provides an app that allows you to record video to questions but it is not a interactive with friends/family/staff members at senior living community etc. Liveon.com is somewhat different. Telling a life story shouldn't be difficult and shouldn't be a big undertaking that happens toward the end of someone's life. It should be easy, fun and happen over the course of 15-20 years. It should enlighten your family and friends while living and provoke more questions.

column182: Lean Media uses offline data analytics & IP geo-location to help advertisers reach online audiences with greater precision & specificity.
column183: Lean Media maps physical addresses to IP addresses to programmatically deliver online banner ads to advertisers’ target audiences directly at the household or business level. This unique approach to addressable online display advertising focuses on using offline demographic and psychographic attributes to target individuals and households on all major ad networks and exchanges and across devices vs. relying only on third-party cookies and past online behavior to target devices. The result is more relevance for the viewer and increased ROAS (Return on Advertising Spend) for the advertiser.

column182: StickyPop is a geo-network where users create virtual spots at a location and post content available only to others physically at that spot.
column183:
StickyPop is a social platform where users can create and name virtual news feeds "Spots" at their current location.  The trick is that only users whom are physically at that "Spot" can see and comment on the content posted to the spot (Pics, videos and text). This makes the posted content visibly limited by the Spot's geographical location (i.e. A user can only create, see, post and comment if they are physically there).  

Most platforms "push" posted content out to anyone that is a user of the platform.  StickyPop "narrows" and limits visibility of posted content to a specific location.  Making StickyPop a social platform that is exclusive location.  Our goal is to provide a completely new system that people will use to better connect and share with others in their direct environment.  

For example, imagine you are a college student out with your friends at a local bar/club/venue. There is currently no way for you to virtually connect with others at that venue.  You open StickyPop and immediately see what other people at that venue (or who have been there before) have posted, while remaining completely invisible to others until you post to that Spot.  

StickyPop is the first system to be legitimate by telemetry, relevant by location and designed to allow users to "Opt-in" to the experience.

Our “Opt-In” system allows users to stay completely invisible until they post. Users are not anonymous, which provides an accountability of posted content
column196:
YikYak - provides completely random posts in a general area. We focus on posts at a specific location, making our content more relevant, legitimate and valuable. www.yikyakapp.com

MeetMe - displays and connects users by profiles. We create public communication at a spot, keeping users invisible until they post (increasing privacy and control). www.meetme.com/

Whisper - posted information has no relevance to specific location, situation, or person, decreasing the value to users.

column209:
The "chicken and egg" - As a geo-social network startup the greatest challenge is to reach community critical mass and obtain viral user base growth.  With a limited marketing budget, our current efforts are in finding the appropriate growth hacking tactics for our system. We need foster the growth of our user base with in app features that allow for users to push our product to other users while adhereing to our privacy and limited visibility of posted content commitments.  

We believe that younger social media users are moving away from traditional platforms because they fear that they will be judged by their parents, grandparents and future employers for what they post.  This creates a dilemma in that Facebook and Twitter can be leveraged for viral growth, but we still want to create a distance from those platforms in order to foster younger users to post without fear.

column182: Making the largest annual pilgrimage easier and safer with technology.
column183:
Hajj Guider will provide each and every pilgrim a solution to deal with their problems. Millions of pilgrims who perform Hajj every year face many problems. 

Following are the key features Hajj Guider will offer to facilitate the pilgrims:

- Providing routes and navigation for pilgrims.
- Tracking friends/family members
- Avoidance from stampedes by live-updates.
- Monitoring pilgrim’s movement in real-time in order to facilitate them in emergency situation.
- Wearable device for spatial awareness between family members.
- Local Emergency Services
- Hotel & Transport Recommendations
- Tour Guides
- Steps to Follow
- Dynamic Itinerary

column16:
Every business, employee, and entrepreneur should have accessible and organized links for research, project execution, and training purposes. Yet, no one has provided a great solution to this problem until now.

Linkship solves this problem because it's brilliantly simple and easy to use, it catalogs the links that teams share with each other, and over time it develops better bookmarking habits.

With Linkship your team never has to waste time searching for missing links again. They will always have a fully searchable, archived, and beautifully organized digital library of project links.

column183:
Losing important links in your inbox and chat history while working on a project is a big problem. Until now, no company has directly addressed this problem, or deeply analyzed the behaviors and technologies that make it ubiquitous. We have.

We recognize the value of time, and utility and importance of links. We've structured our service around this idea and arrived at different results that will save people time and money.

Linkship will combine the best features of Pocket, Point, and Pinboard and cater to those who research, design, and build awesome things together.

column195:
We are both freelancers and links are the currency by which we get work done. We don't just want this product, we desperately need it. Because of our design and engineering background and our cumulative 14 years of experience, we're uniquely positioned to solve this problem.

First impressions are key; and the execution, performance, company culture, branding, and usability are what keep people coming back to a product. We are obsessed with these factors -- with the nitty, gritty details.
column196:
Our noteworthy competitors include Point (http://www.getpoint.co), Pinboard (https://pinboard.in), Kippt/Inc (kippt.com/), Pinterest (www.pinterest.com/) and Pocket (https://getpocket.com).

We're focused on saving our customers time and money through superior features and interface design. Because we auto-populate email contacts for our users, sharing is free from any "marketplace" issues.
Unlike our competitors, we will integrate with established chat, filesharing, and messaging services.
column197:
We're starting with a freemium model to onboard users. We'll then offer a $10 monthly upgraded subscription option.

The total U.S. designer/developer population of $3.5M represents our core customer base. We will focus on on-boarding 5%, and then convert 3% of that group to paying customers. Linkship would also be useful to entrepreneurs, journalists, teachers, scientists, and other similar research fields. We believe we can eventually grow to make $42M in gross revenue per year.
column198:
Our personal contacts represent our core demographic, and they've been anticipating our launch. Word-of-mouth is our best ally, and we're well connected in the Saint Louis entrepreneurial scene.

We'll email users who have received numerous links through our service, but haven't signed up. The incentive will be clear; if they sign up they'll be able to see the links. A drip email strategy is also pending.

We'll partner with the influencers in our industries to get quality endorsements.
column200: We launched our private beta this month which focuses on a tight set of features for the Gmail/Chrome/Desktop user. We are currently working tightly with 6 beta testers in our core demographic to de-bug, track usage, and collect feedback.
column201:
Next, we'll work on launching an upgraded monthly subscription service while giving demos and taking pre-orders. The upgraded service will include UI tweaks, custom link categorization (Linkboards), webpage archiving, keyword search, team permissions and notifications, admin management, and linkboard publishing and sharing. This will take us ~1.5 months of full-time work.

In the next year, integration with chat and project management software will be important. We'll also widen our user base by adding further browser, device, and email service support.
column208: Aside from entering an accelerator program, we have no immediate plans to enter into a round of funding. Gaining a substantial amount of customer traction is very important to us at this stage, and we feel it's an important first step in gauging the market and honing our product further. Being able to work on the project full-time would be priceless.
column209:
Our greatest challenge is finding the time to work on Linkship as much as we would like to. We are both Independant Contractors, and still need to pay the bills while we are developing Linkship. 

Our second greatest challenge lies in the details. Crafting a functional, beautiful, user-friendly, and un-beatable product that anticipates all user-cases takes incredible amounts of tenacity, follow-through, and attention to detail. We are obsessed with making our customer base happy.

column10: An anxiety app that pairs with existing wearables for real-time therapy
column16:
We aim to improve mental health care through wearable and mobile technology.  The DataDog app measures heart rate and other metrics to help users better understand their stress.  By notifying users when we detect anxiety, we create opportunities to build coping skills when they are needed the most.  The app provides cognitive behavioral therapy, mindfulness practices, and other strategies for keeping the unhelpful symptoms of stress in check.  Our web portal and API gives users access to their data.  Physiological and user-input data drive insights about where, when, and why stress occurs, as well as what techniques are best for coping.  

DataDog strives to aggregate modern, proven psychological practices with machine learning techniques for a personalized approach to anxiety therapy. We're constantly striving to make this world an easier place to live for those suffering from anxiety. Whether you're a college student wanting to put a stop to your panic attacks or an individual working a high-profile job with 60-hour work weeks, we've got your back- woof!
column17: Applying fitness tracker principles to improve mental health is a nascent field. We develop clinically validated, useful tools.
column39: Biomedical engineer and developer turned entrepreneur
column65: MD/PhD at Wash U studying brain-computer interfaces and CTO of DataDog Health, developing a mental perfomance app that uses wearable HRMs
column72:
My Co-Founder Elizabeth Russell and I create DataDog Health, a software company that has built the Mindset App. This app connects with 3rd party wearable heart rate monitors and detects stress/relaxation levels. Mindset provides tools from Mindfulness, Cognitive Therapy and Positive Psychology to help you optimize thoughts, emotions and behaviors. Mindset is to mental health what Fitbit is the physical health. Set weekly goals and track your stress levels geo-spatially. At the end of each day, find out how many hours you've spent in a stressful state and use the Mindset toolkit to optimize stress and relaxation levels.

I was a founding member of IDEA Labs, a student run biotech incubator that was founded out of Wash U. My first winning IL team built a device designed to help a paralyzed patient communicate (http://learn.parallax.com/inspiration/kinocom). 

I work in a brain computer interface lab. I am building a brain-computer interface to improve attention after stroke.
column182: We develop and distribute web and mobile applications that provide real-time anxiety coping tools for smartphone users who own wearables
column183:
We are launching the DataDog app and web portal to help people manage and reduce anxiety.  Our platform will pair with any wearable heart rate device through bluetooth, including smart-watches.  In addition to heart rate, DataDog tracks location, movement, and subjective emotional input to generate a stress profile for the user.  

If a user gets fed up with his boss at work and his stress levels increase, the DataDog app will send his phone a notification. Not only will the notification remind him of his emotional state, it will provide ways for the user to reduce stress. If the user doesn't  engage with DataDog  in that moment, he can address the notification any time afterward. Later, when the user is home or with his therapist, he can sign into the DataDog web portal and view when and where his stress levels were increased. He can then schedule exercises and set goals for the future.

The set of tools that DataDog app and web portal provides allows users to identify personal triggers and establish helpful stress management strategies with or without a therapist. Therapy options include cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT), a clinically validated tool which challenges the user to dispute their anxiety-producing beliefs. The exercises also include mindfulness based stress reduction another validated stress relief tools.

DataDog is a companion for people with stress and anxiety. It will know when you are stressed and help you get through it.
column185: We have created a working app that provides the functions stated above. However, we are eager to start working with the potential clients who have said they want our app. We hope to developed focused user testing through Capital Innovators. A network of experienced entrepreneurs will help us better understand our customers. We will use the program to launch a consumer stress app and pilot a clinical app.

Ravi Chacko, CTO:  Ravi has done bioelectrical signal processing for 10 years. He develops the heart rate metrics and stress profile algorithms.  He also maintains relationships with clinical advisors and plans the pilot studies.
column188:

Ravi is a co-founder and executive board member of IDEA Labs, a nonprofit startup that fosters innovation and venture formation around clinical needs cultivated from Washington University clinicians.

column194: St. Louis, although we may relocate based on funding opportunities.
column195: We differentiate a product from a sea of health apps in two ways:  1) We found our product on evidence-based therapies and seek proof of clinical outcomes through validation.  2) Our strong background in biological signal processing and machine learning makes us uniquely qualified to both improve real-time stress predictions and visualize the data in engaging ways.
column196:
HeartMath (heartmath.com)
Olive (witholive.com)
Haraweb (haraweb.it)

Unlike our competitors, our approach is device and platform agnostic, enabling our company to grow with the ever-changing wearable technology market.  Additionally, we provide evidence-based tools and our advisors are clinical leaders in the field.  We target anxiety disorder patients, which adds clinical validity to our consumer-facing stress app. Our competitors focus on fitness and general wellness.
column197: Monetization is based on a "freemium" subscription model. We allow the user to download our app for free with heart rate tracking functionality and limited therapeutic exercises. We charge subscription for service features that include record keeping, heart rate alerts, enhanced therapeutic offerings, scheduling and goal setting. Our customers are people with anxiety disorders, people who want to reduce stress, or people who are interested in self-tracking their mental health
column198: An initial release and test group will be a patient population at Barnes-Jewish Hospital.  We will simultaneously reach out to our therapeutic contacts in St Louis for a controlled release and testing phase. We will subsequently market through therapists and online.  Publication in journals and appearance at psychology/psychiatry conferences will connect us to more therapists to win recommendations, while web marketing will bring in a wide population of users.
column200: The app currently connects, via bluetooth, to the Zephyr and Polar heart rate chest straps. Once connected, DataDog displays heart rate and related statistics.  The DataDog algorithm can separate stressful moments from other situations that raise one's heart rate. We are currently collecting data from friends and optimizing stress detection. We have collected  6 months of user data.
column201:
Our next milestone is to obtain our first 10 sub-clinical customers and commence a clinical pilot study. We expect to achieve 10 customers by January 2015 and to commence our pilot study by Spring of next year.

We are pursuing both a clinical and sublinical app simultaneously. Sub-clinical stress costs the US hundreds of billions of dollars in lost productivity. We will provide a consumer app free of cost and rapidly collect customer usage data and preferences. We have a working prototype and need direct user feedback. After a limited beta, we will launch next year.

The clinically-oriented app will serve customers who have great need for reminders and therapeutic tools. We are working closely with psychiatrists from Washington University in St. Louis to design a pilot study. We expect this study to begin in 6 months.

Through both consumer-facing and clinically-oriented approaches we will provide a high quality app for different user requirements.

Through our market research we are confident users will download our free app but we will soon face the challenge of monetizing it without loosing too many customers.

column182: Listo is an app that plays the Spanish track of a movie as the user is watching the film in English.
column183: Listo has the world’s best syncing software as well as the first patent to be filed in this space.  The essence of the Listo app is that it finds a common ground between entertainment and people.  It provides access for ESL (English as a second language) people to go to the theater and enjoy movies.   Hollywood studios are actively seeking ways to broadly appeal their products to more people as box office revenues continue to decline (Summer 2014 box office was down 12%).   Listo appeals to an  underserved community (primarily US Hispanics) by giving them the option of seeing Hollywood tentpole movies in the theater in their preferred language.

column209: The greatest challenge of Listo is launching a game changing technology into an established industry.  Though film and television studios along with movie theaters are all seeing declining revenue and consumers participation in their product, the industry is slow to adapt.  The reintroduction of 3D is an example in recent years of studios and theater’s attempt to bring additional people and revenue in.  However, as with 3D, new entertainment products take time to adapt.   Studio’s primary concern is piracy of a film’s soundtrack.  Listo’s technology addresses all aspects of piracy.   Theater's primary concern is smartphone interruptions in the theater.  Listo addresses these concerns as well.

column181: When I was starting SPRY Analytics (previously Luca Financial Services) in St. Louis, my brother introduced me to his friend Adam Regelmann, whose company Quartzy won the grand prize at Washington University’s Olin Cup competition in February 2010. Adam shared his insights on the St. Louis start up environment with me, and introduced me to Ken Harrington at Wash U.’s Skandalaris Center. Ken in turn introduced me to Jim Brasunas (ITEN), and my conversations with both of them turned independently towards Capital Innovators as a leading accelerator, both regionally and nationally, where SPRY Analytics would be a good fit.
column182: SPRY's software for financial professionals can reduce their clients' taxes during retirement with optimized account withdrawal strategies.
column183:
Millions of Americans are sitting on healthy nest eggs, but that money can come with an unwelcome side effect: sizable tax liabilities. With trillions of dollars invested in tax-deferred asset accounts like IRAs and 401(k)s, many retirees are facing large tax bills when they reach the withdrawal phase of their investment timeline. These looming tax bills have been characterized as a "time bomb" for retirees, but SPRY Analytics views it as an opportunity to offer a solution combining professional expertise and knowledge of retirement planning and a proprietary software service that seeks to optimize a strategic withdrawal plan to minimize taxes. 

SPRY Analytics was formed with the idea that software can be designed to lower the costs of professional expertise and time for individuals who will benefit from a tax-optimized withdrawal strategy before and during retirement. The software reduces the cost and simplifies the process for professionals who want to provide the service to clients. Such analyses are already possible when performed by qualified professionals dedicating significant hours to the process, but the costs of such analyses can reduce or eclipse the benefits they uncover. SPRY's software employs proprietary algorithms to deliver straightforward account withdrawal strategies designed to minimize taxes, and requires only a few minutes to input clients' personal and account information.
column184:
Demo screencast: http://spryanalytics.com/demo/
Functional prototype: http://spry.dev.tuvastaging.com/ and log in as spry, with password of spryadmin

As a recruiter, he is identifying and filling the crucial gaps in his team's skill sets. And as a CEO he is overseeing the evolution of SPRY's business model and is the point man for keeping the company funded.

Dave joined new media start-up company Gothamist LLC as it coalesced into a hyper-local new media success. When NBC Universal spun up its Local Integrated Media division from the ground up, Dave was hired to help impart a start-up editorial tone and ethos.  He was later hired as a NY editor by Curbed LLC, another successful start-up since acquired by Vox Media, one of the U.S.'s largest and fastest-growing online publishers.

Scott is the founder and Managing Director of Applied Numerics LLC.
column190: Scott is the founder and Managing Director of another start-up, Applied Numerics LLC. He is committed to the development of SPRY Analytics' product and will remain committed to the software's subsequent releases and enhancements. Commitments to Applied Numerics LLC, however, prevent him making SPRY an exclusive focus of his abilities.
column193: Scott Johnson is the Managing Director of another start-up, Applied Numerics LLC. Although Scott is a St. Louis local and committed to working with SPRY Analytics, we do not feel that his full time participation will be assured (or required) for the duration of the accelerator program.
column194: The physical location of SPRY will be determined by the best interests of the company, including access to capital and advisors and proximity to early customers.
column195: What makes SPRY Analytics unique is its singular focus on finding the simplest solution to a very complex problem. The challenge of finding an optimal withdrawal strategy is not unknown to financial advisors. The rule of thumb is inefficiently relied upon because of its speed and simplicity. SPRY software strips away the expenses—time and expertise—that limit the application of individualized withdrawal strategies, and offers them to a much broader market than previously possible.
column196:
Most financial advisors and accountants use software to help manage client accounts that include features that take into account the effect of taxes on individual investment plans. What sets SPRY's software apart is its ability to run an optimization algorithm on a client's current financial scenario that recommends a strategic withdrawal path to minimize taxes over an entire investment horizon.   
Space constraints here limit our ability to list competitors and URLs. Please contact for info.
column197: SPRY has a Software as a Service (SaaS) business model, in which we will sell subscriptions for our software to financial professionals, like financial advisors and tax accountants. Subscriptions will scale along a single axis at first, based on the number of users in customer’s office, followed by the development of premium features that we can offer as an upsell to existing customers, increasing their lifetime value as customers and offsetting churn.
column198: Because of the size of our addressable and target markets, SPRY Analytics is going to focus on inbound marketing in an effort to align our customer acquisition costs within the market. This means running a software site, as well as an information source for potential customers. Other aspects of inbound marketing we’ll focus on are SEO, social media, email, and leveraging communities at existing professional platforms such as LinkedIn.

column201: SPRY's next milestone is the completion of our software's algorithmic optimization engine and its integration into our functional prototype.  We expect to reach that milestone within the next 10 weeks.

column10: Expert in automating recurring processes for small business
column182: ActionFlow empowers a business owner to design efficient processes and then implement those processes for each job.
column183:
Many small business owners and employees are overwhelmed by their daily ToDo list.  The sheer volume of tasks required to run a small business can lead to inefficiency, stress and poor customer service.   ActionFlow gives the owner a way to easily define what steps he wants to happen for each job.  After that process is defined, ActionFlow  prompts each employee to take the appropriate step at the appropriate time.  Automating those processes increases efficiency, reduces stress, and improves customer service.
The target market for ActionFlow includes any enterprise where a significant portion of daily tasks are part of a repetitive processes.  For example, a company that installs kitchen countertops performs essentially the same tasks over and over again.  Many businesses are similar, such as roofers, real estate agents, window and door companies, insurance agencies, just to name a few.
Having come out of the kitchen countertop industy, I am targeting that market as my first vertical market.  I currently have seven paying customers (companies) and am collecting $37,800 in annual revenue.  My largest company has 85 users.

column10: Web-based practice and case management for personal injury lawyers
column39: Grew up in around the law with finance, tech, & economics background
column181: My friend Nic Meliones of BitWall told me about Capital Innovators and suggested I apply
column182: We make law firms more efficient by increasing productivity and drive higher verdicts and settlements by providing benchmarking & analytics
column183: We are a SaaS software company and will make software. We have two distinct "products" if that's how you wish to think of them but the one facilitates the other. We have case management and research/analytics. The case management software is free. This is free approach is a different angel in that no other web-based platforms are free (there is one downloadable one, Houdini Esq but only one user can be on it). The big competitors here are Cio (goclio.com) and LexisNexis (lexis.com) but neither offer case management for free. We are focusing on small or solo law firm practices so this is a huge selling point as they try to save money where ever they can. The analytics/research tool is entirely unique and different. This tool allows attorneys to visualize thousands of cases by injury, insurance provider, county, or judge to see how the value of the case would be impacted. Additionally, they will be able to see the likelihood a certain judge will approve or deny their motions, the average cost and average revenue for similar cases (think an ROI for each case) - all in an effort to help them craft litigation strategies and drive higher verdicts and settlements, which means more profits.
column185: We want the ability to work full-time and invest 100% of our effort and time into Litigo - going through an accelerator would allow us to pay ourselves and focus on building a great company. From there I anticipate using out week of week growth and early revenue traction to raise a series A. I would like the seed money to be $150-200k. The Series A will depend on traction as I would look to take on only as much as was needed to build significant value for a Series B round but something around $1M or $1.5M
column209: Like any startup being discovered is the hardest. Just because we have spent 6 months working on an MVP doesn't mean people will be breaking down our door to use it. We need to find people in our space and often times convince them to do things differently. This is out greatest challenge because without customers we are nothing. The next challenge that goes hand in hand with finding customers is what to charge them. There aren't great comparable out there right now because we are doing something so different. Though this is a big question mark it will be answered on our way to product/market fit so its an unknown but we are not as concerned as customers will tell us what they would pay based on how well we meet their need.

column10: NASA JPL systems engineer and WUSTL physics PhD student. Systems wonk.
column182: Nanaya forecasts love and social outcomes for users, generating a database of user life desire demographically and geographically tagged.
column183:
Nanaya offers a romantic options forecasting and decision analysis to consumers, not matchmaking: Nanaya forecasts love, it doesn't find it. There is no one else that provides objective affirmation of romantic decisions. We are the bookends of online dating, a $4B industry, we help people find love and then affirm it when it's found.

While in the past there have been attempts to predict the chances of finding love, we offer the first general solution to the problem. Moreover, we extend this solution to provide deeper answers to the questions of love: Where should you move to find love? Should you stay with your significant other or find someone else? When is the best time to settle down? Nanaya answers these questions and more powered by an algorithm developed through experience in cost and risk analysis for NASA space missions. 

The user data required for the algorithm is far deeper than what is obtained by Facebook, IAC, and eHarmony. We don't just get personality or consumer preferences but ask hard questions about life history, life goals, and desires surround a major life and consumer decision. Unlike anyone else, we will have desire and history data that cannot be determined via extrapolation from other analytics metrics. This data is of high value to many industries as we can predict market shifts in banking, real estate, pharmaceutical, government, and more. 

By offering a free service, we are poised to obtain this high value data, frequently, at low cost.
column184:
www.nanaya.co

Personality testing will be ready during the holiday season. Beta will be ready by February 2015. Final product will be ready by Q3 2015.
column185:
First and foremost, sponsorship. I am currently self-funding and fully committed. 

Second, exposure. My product generates value through the number of end-users who use it. The mentorship and networking through Capital Innovators will help me broaden my horizons in how I market and establish the product, especially for data analytics.

Finally, mentorship. Though I am experienced in government/defense work its very risk adverse nature, business is new. I need support adapting to the new culture.
column186: Rashied Amini - Founder, CEO, Theorist
column188:
If there were an corollary to startups in NASA, it would be novel proposal work. In such a case, yes. With only a BS in physics, I have applied and won many grants to study technologies and science investigations by self-education, building a team of experts, and leading them through successful studies.

I have also been a systems engineer for space missions (interplanetary internet demonstrations, total $3M efforts), developing schedules, testing, planning, and management.All missions succeeded
column190: My PhD can be put on hold but there are some long-term NASA obligations I may continue to support that are sensitive, related to national security. This would be <8hrs/week. I normally work 70+ hour weeks anyway for fun so this is in the noise. I have retired my obligations in study management in these sensitive efforts.
column195:
There are no other services that provide end-user romantic decision analysis, though family, friends, and therapists can be considered competitors. In the B2C market, we are simply peerless and have the enabling technology provisionally protected. Our B2C service will be on a "freemium" model.

The data we obtain from users is novel as will be explained below. Based on our database, we can generate strategic demographic reports of user desires relevant to many markets.
column196:
Online matchmaking does determine user romantic personalities and Facebook aggregates "like" data used in marketing. The data we require for the algorithm is very deep and unique: user life plans. Specifically, romantic history, life history, current social circles and behavior, desires for settling down and children, desires for specific professions and places to live, etc. 

Our competitors, Facebook, Google, and IAC, can extrapolate some of these desire - we will have definitive answers.
column197:
B2C: The freemium model will draw users in for free results with some for-pay reports answering major romantic and social questions (e.g. "Should I dump my boyfriend?" or "Where should I move?"). 

B2B: We have many different avenues for revenue.
-Selling data for analytics. We can sell (non)-personal data by developing new DB queries. Societal trends in desire can be rapidly developed.
-Licensing to IAC or eHarmony. Our backend can be readily accessed via an API that we can license.
-Therapists
column198:
We plan on following the OkCupid model due to its success. 

We will offer free personality testing separate of the main product. We will generate content through a sociology blog similar to 
OkCupid's. We will offer a free service. The content and free service will attract customers with a low CAC. Initially, we plan on a media campaign, addressing relevant markets in conferences and conventions, and mass marketing though these should eventually give way to word-of-mouth like OkCupid.
column200: By the end of December, we should have some metrics on cost of customer acquisition for end users/B2C based on the number of people utilizing personality testing and signing up for the beta program for mid-2015. We are fastidiously tracking web analytics to understand the social media response to our engagement. We will track these through all stages.
column201:
We have several upcoming milestones. The soonest is opening of personality testing in late November 2014 for which we are on-track. Opening of invite-only Beta testing around Valentine’s Day is the next. After which we will continue to refine our product through Beta feedback until it is ready for a complete launch.

The founder is a NASA systems engineer and has flight project experience. He has developed a development schedule in the spirit of space flight projects. Unknown complexity and issues have been margined for. Failure is not an option.
column203: We will incorporate January 2015 as a Delaware LLC.
column208: Yes. We will need to raise about $70k before August 2015.
column209:
The below are unique strategic high-level risks to Nanaya. There are other tactical issues, but these must be acknowledged as deal-breakers. We have developed mitigation strategies accordingly.

1.	Challenge: This is a new market and we are unable to assess actual market demand or future CAC.

Mitigation: Obviously there is significant risk to acknowledge in our ignorance. First and foremost, we will market ourselves as adjacent to the already successful online dating market as a complimentary service. We will use familiarity and use of online dating as a vector for advertising and branding.

OkCupid was stunningly successful till its buyout by IAC.  Thus, we will follow the rise of OkCupid as a template where appropriate. We will provide personality testing in the manner OkCupid did during their Spark period. We will generate content in the form of our blog which will do sociology studies of our dataset. We will offer a freemium service (their A-List premium service was instituted under IAC control). All of these will drive CAC low. We seek to achieve <$1.00 CAC in the long-run. Initially, we expect higher cost to build brand familiarity, $2-4/customer.

2.	Challenge: User unwillingness to complete the assessment. Because it takes 15-30m to fill out the survey, users may be unwilling to sit down and take the time for results. 

Mitigation: A contractor who designs UX for the elderly is designing the interface in a user-friendly manner to make input effortless. Moreover, a partnership with Traity ensures that the most tedious portion, scientific personality testing, is enjoyable, fast, accurate, and even potentially viral.

The Beta test program will work to clean the product to the most user-friendly state iteratively converging on a final UI/UX.

3.	Challenge: Finding B2B customers. While we know there is tremendous value in the novel data we will obtain, we are not connected with potential customers to determine the value or structure of the product.

Mitigation: Networking and applying to Capital Innovators. Working with future investors to obtain customers.

4.	Challenge: Traitify licensing. While we stand to have a low CAC, we will pay <$0.50 for every personality test. This is a long-term risk to our revenue stream.

Mitigation: Traitify is transitioning from its previous structure of developing tests for professionals to a web API. We are their first major customer and will work to tailor the product to our needs. This does not mitigate cost but creates the groundwork for a strategic collaboration where we share complimentary goals in the market.

column10: Jobsite Unite streamlines jobsite communication for construction workers
column11: Architecture & Construction,Jobs & Recruiting,Mobile,Productivity & CRM,Software,Training & Coaching,Collaboration Tools,Construction,Employee Engagement,Employee/Labor Relations,Mobile Applications,SaaS
column16: Jobsite Unite connects construction workers, enabling simplified jobsite communication.  Through a desktop or mobile app workers can access jobsite or company groups to share comments, photos, and files about project status. Workers can also message each other directly. Planned group features will allow workers to share project schedules, updates, and progress via real-time reporting.

column181: We were invited to apply by Scott Bernstein
column182: We are disrupting the construction industry by using technology to streamline communication to reduce the $55 billion efficiency problem.
column183:
The complexity of construction projects requires changes to schedules and planning to happen daily. Miscommunication leads to waiting and delays which results in additional costs to the project owner, the contractor, and all the subs involved. Commonly attributed to poor project communication, cost overrun in US construction results in $55 billion annually. We are reducing mistakes and wasted time with clear, open jobsite communication through a mobile and web application.

Most recent efforts to introduce technology into construction have been focused on solutions for the office. Our product is focused on getting information to and from the field, where it is most critically needed. As a consequence, we are targeting one of the biggest and untapped market segments in the construction industry, the subcontractors. Currently, subcontractors do not have a unified platform to store and share scheduling information with other teams across multiple projects.

Jobsite Unite provides project and industry wide access to critical information and resources needed in everyday construction operations. The ability to communicate with any member of a project or team will vastly reduce wasted time, materials, and labor. Project managers, superintendents and foremen will spend less time communicating schedules, changes, reassigning locations, and relocating equipment and manpower while enabling employees with the vital information they need for day to day operations.
column185: We are tackling an enormous problem and realize that we cannot do it alone. At the accelerator we want to achieve two goals. (1) Refine and perfect our business model to find a scalable, repeatable sales and marketing process that can be used to exponentially grow adoption of our product Worldwide. (2) Connect and grow relationships with key partners and mentors that have experience, knowledge, and insight into our market who will help grow our business during and after the program.

column195: Jobsite Unite is unique because we are the only company providing a solution that mimics how the construction industry communicates today. We take the informal, scattered information that is organically created on construction sites and provide a central location for it to be stored and shared. We then provide tools that organize and display this data in a convenient and functional way. We will have reached our goal when there is no skilled construction worker left without work.
column196: There are several companies addressing the communication and efficiency struggles in construction. At Jobsite Unite we are taking a drastically different approach. Www.fieldlens.com, www.fieldwire.net, and www.plangrid.com currently seem to have the most traction. Their solutions all require a significant shift in jobsite workflow and work habits, while Jobsite Unite compliments how construction sites organically function. This results in a much smaller learning curve and wider user adoption.
column197: Jobsite Unite is a B2B SaaS company that sells monthly subscriptions. Our customers are mid-large size construction companies that need a better way to communicate with their employees or with subs on their jobsites. The platform also offers a Linkedin-like network which allows individuals to create a free profile and connect with others in their market.
column198: We are utilizing (2) different avenues for finding and signing up customers. (1) The top down approach: By marketing directly to general contractors, we can contractually obligate everyone on a jobsite to sign up for and use our product. (2) The bottom up approach: By marketing to and signing up individuals to our network, we generate soft leads to the companies they work for which we can then pursue.

column209:
Fundraising: We have about a 3 month window from when we run out of our current funds until we are anticipating revenue. We need to raise some more operating funds to support sales, support, and marketing efforts. We initially planned to raise an entire seed round of $450,000 pre-product and pre-revenue. We were able to successfully raise $80,000 in private and $50,000 in the form of a loan from Iowa. We stopped raising and focused on building. Now the product is done, and we need to raise more money to give us a sales and implementation runway.

Sales/Marketing/Operations: Our current sales, implementation, and marketing strategy is very high touch and costly. Currently we have established a very successful plan for gaining traction locally, and establishing product validation. Moving forward, we are going to be tasked with the challenge of scaling our high touch sales, implementation, and support on an international level. Our plan is to convert from this high touch model to a more scalable market share model that is focused on online advertising and inbound customer support.

To sum things up, our biggest obstacle is getting everyone on the teams 100% focus. We have done a great job building a rockstar team who really believes in what we are trying to do. Now we need to secure the resources that would enable all the team members to work on what they are passionate about 100% of their time.

column183:
Grind Nation will deliver a service focused on three components which include gym, content and customer relationship systems.  All aspects of our customer experience include three basic concepts; collaboration, social media and mobility.  The key focus of our Software as a Service is to provide a platform which offers everything a small business owner or like-minded individual needs to enable swift growth.  Let's call this our Business Management System.  This tenancy based model offers high profit margins enabling us to provide the "Apple"-like experience to our customers.  

Providing a service of this capacity allows business owners to manage and grow their business, building a strong community within their industry. Currently similar products only offer one of several complimentary components, where Grind Nation brings in the most important aspects; managing their business, relationships with customers, marketing their business, and creating a community where their customers see great personal growth. When these components work seamlessly, success is sustainable allowing superior growth. A current customer has experienced more satisfied customers, and their business has seen the reward in growth due to the services we provide.

Problems are simple, every business needs the services we offer. How do they piece it together? We offer a single point of integration in a tenancy based service that is flexible enough for any small business, though we focus on health and fitness.

column10: Better living through data.
column11: Data & Analytics,Health/Medical,Software,Data Analysis,Data Mining,Data Visualization,Fitness,Health,Machine Learning,Psychometrics,Quantitative Analysis,Sleep Disorders,Wellbeing,Wellness,Wellness Coaching,Wellness Initiatives,Wellness Programming,Wellness Programs
column16:
Mining life-tracking data for hidden causes of illness and the most effective ways to improve your life.

QuantiMo.do Web Platform 
A platform that can integrate data from any application or device, visualize this data, and mine it for predictive relationships and determine personal optimal parameters for life. 

QM Connector Framework
The QM Connector Framework automatically pulls data from other services including:
Rescuetime - Time Tracking
WhatPulse - Keystroke and Mouse Behaviour
Fitbit - Sleep Duration, Sleep Quality, Steps, Physical Activity
Withings - Blood Pressure, Weight, Environmental CO2 Levels, Ambient Temperature
World Weather Online - Local Humidity, Cloud Cover, Temperature
Facebook - Social Interaction, Likes
Github - Code Commits
MyFitnessPal - Food and Nutrient Intake
MoodPanda - Basic Reported Mood
MoodScope - Detailed Reported Mood Using Panas
Sleep as Android - Snoring, Deep Sleep, Reported Sleep Rating
BodyMedia - Sleep Duration, Sleep Quality, Steps, Physical Activity
RunKeeper - Physical Activity
MyNetDiary - Food and Nutrient Intake, Vital Signs

QM Analytics Dashboard
Data streams can be combined and visually analyzed on a timeline to evaluate one’s progress over time and explore the data to find insights.

QuantiModo Analytics Engine
Anyone wanting to optimize any quantifiable aspect of their life is able to search and see a list of the factors that are most effective at helping the average user achieve a particular health and wellness goal.  For instance, if one wishes to improve one’s mood, go to our site and search for "mood", where one is able to select from the list of products that most affect mood.  If the user provides their data, it can also determine the most likely optimal daily values for the various factors.

QM Universal Tracker for Android 
An app that enables the user to easily track diet, medication, physical activity, anything else that can be quantified and automatically upload the data for analysis. 

QM Universal Tracker for Google Chrome
A web browser extension that lets the user track diet, medication, physical activity, and anything else that can be quantified.

column39: I'm a software developer, technologist, dedicated to travel.

column182: We are a social network for travelers to share and create travel itineraries.
column183:
Travelers today face two key problems:

1. Planning travel trip itinerary is tedious; involves googling various travel blogs. reviews and Q&A, which is  good, but leaves much to be desired.

2. Once the trip starts, no easy way exists to capture sequence & details of travel itineraries; photos scatter across social networks, phones, computers; memories fade with time.

column182: Ziphops.com,  is a socially driven site were users share information to better educate others of what to know when traveling to a new city.
column183:
Ziphops.com is different from other social travel sites in its simplicity and easy to find travel information. Many other sites are more on the narrative side while ziphops covers at a high level exactly what you need to know when going to a city.  When arriving at the airport in Nashville most people would think to get a cab from the airport to downtown but most people are not aware that there is a bus that picks up at the airport and you can get a ride to downtown for $1.70.  Categories consist of Events, Trip Tips, Daily Deals (Drink and Food Specials), Shopping Tips, Radio Stations, Places to See, Kid Friendly, Restaurants, Honky Tonks, Nightlife and Karaoke Spots. 
We are different for the following reasons
- more concise post
- great filter tools
- like option - users can like post to give them a higher relevancy on the site
- share on facebook
- see others that are going to an event before you actually go to the event
- trending - section shows the post getting the most traction
- recent - most recent post
- category - filter by category
- post - easy to post and share section

Ziphops.com fills a niche that no one else has filled and no doubt will be a success.

Second, choose your favorite vendors, whether it is one of our preferred partners or another company that you know and trust.  Then just invite your family and friends!  We only charge a small fixed fee out of the funds raised.  And the credit card fees are paid for by the vendors, so you don't have to!

column182: iDoFund is a web app that helps couples crowdfund their weddings with no credit card fees.
column183: iDoFund is a crowd-funding web app where the brides, grooms and their guests can raise money for their wedding without being assessed credit card fees.  Additionally, key vendor partners and a fixed pricing model gives iDoFund an competitive advantage over other solutions. Vendor partners pay for credit card processing and no other fees.  There is a minimal crowd funding layout with video, "pay what you want" gift button, stretch goals, and bride and groom blog updates.  It will be the "flexible" campaign type where you can keep whatever is funded to you.  iDoFund uses the stretch goals concept with one vendor per stretch goal.  In this way, only one vendor is being funded at a time. When Vendor A is fully funded, then Vendor B is funded and so-on.  This allows the Bride and Grooms to prioritize their vendors, and only one vendor will be partially funded at any point in time.  Money is collected by iDoFund and paid directly to the vendors via bank transfer (via Stripe).  With this money-flow, it makes the monetary gifts more meaningful. The Bride and Groom will receive a paper gift-certificate to use with the Vendor for their wedding.  Additionally, this money-flow commits the brides to the vendor partners and allows partners to offer promotional pricing and offers.    Instead of large, uncapped percentage fees and credit card fees that are accessed by our competitors, iDoFund charges $39 per vendor out of funds raised.

column10: MeterGenius helps users engage with and lower their electricity usage.
column39: MBA, Kellogg School of Management, Marketing Analytics Mngr at Angie's List
column52: Undergrad in engineering at Oxford, PhD in mech engineering at Northwestern, Co-Founder of MeterGenius
column182: MeterGenius is a customer retention solution for competitive electricity suppliers that helps users engage with and lower their electricity.
column183:
MeterGenius is a free website and mobile app that provides tools and incentives for homeowners to engage with and lower their electricity usage. MeterGenius gives homeowners with smart meters the ability to track electricity consumption at a granular level, create reminders to help them change their behavior, control their smart thermostat, set goals and track their progress, compare themselves to similar neighbors, and earn points that can be redeemed for bill credits.

Our focus on user engagement not only sets us apart from competitors, but has allowed us to deliver superior results - increasing retention by 27%! The 3 pillars of our user engagement strategy work together to strengthen the impact of each other. First, we create user-specific suggestions to help our users become more energy efficient. These suggestions come from our analysis of their smart meter data, as well as their responses to profile questions about their home, consumption habits, and motivations. Our second pillar is the tools that allow our users to act upon the suggestions we make. For example, we currently integrate with Emerson's Sensi, so our users can control their thermostat from our app, or sign up for programs that allow MeterGenius to control their thermostat more efficiently. Finally, the thing that ties all of this together is our rewards program. We provide points for reducing electricity and using energy during low cost times. These points can be redeemed for energy efficient appliances.
column185: The first half of 2015 will be an exciting and important time for MeterGenius as we grow our company, and my main goal for the program is to grow the company as effectively as possible.  I plan on leveraging the Capital Innovators network to find new electricity supplier customers and  new employees.  I want to use the programming and mentoring to further develop my skills as a CEO and guide me through this rapid growth process.

column188: Ty Benefiel began working for Angie's List shortly after the company received its first large VC investment in 2008.  Ty built a marketing analytics team that determined the most efficient way to spend the newly raised capital in order to acquire new paying customers.  While Ty was at Angie's List, the member base grew from 200,000 to over 1.5 million.  Ty worked alongside the co-founder and Chief Marketing Officer, Angie Hicks.
column190: Yves Xie is finishing his PhD in Computer Sciences at Northwestern University and will not graduate until June 2015.  Yves works at least 40 hours per month on MeterGenius.  Fred Thwaites has taken a very limited role with the company and currently has a full time job with another company.  Hillary Hass no longer has a role with the company.
column193: Ty Benefiel and Yan Man, the two founders working full time on the company, will be able to attend the entire program.  The other co-founders are not working full time on MeterGenius.
column195: Unlike competitors, MeterGenius is focused on engaging electricity customers in order to increase retention and reduce energy usage.  Our biggest differentiator is our rewards program, which motivates users to lower their energy usage and use electricity when costs are lowest for electricity suppliers.  Every electricity provider faces variable costs per kWh throughout the day, but no program exists that rewards users for using electricity more during off-peak hours and less during peak hours.
column196: There are multiple energy analytics companies, such as Opower (http://opower.com), Tendril (http://www.tendrilinc.com), MyEnergy(https://www.myenergy.com), and LowFoot (http://www.lowfoot.com), however they’re all designed to lower electricity bills by 2-3% by simply comparing users to their neighbors.  MeterGenius is the only solution for competitive electricity suppliers that is designed to increase customer retention by increasing engagement.  None of these companies have a rewards program.
column197: MeterGenius generates revenue by licensing our software to retail electricity suppliers on a price per customer basis.  We have a flat fee for all customers and additional fees for customers that create an account or opt into our smart thermostat program.  Our second source of revenue comes from selling smart appliances to our users.  These appliances are integrated with the MeterGenius app and are usually purchased by the electricity suppliers and then given to their customers for free.
column198: We sell to marketing decision makers of retail electricity providers. Most of our conversations have resulted from our large network of energy industry veterans. Some potential clients have even reached out to us, as they have heard about MeterGenius through various press hits. We intend to position MeterGenius as an expert in customer engagement by presenting at various industry forums. Our CEO has been invited to speak at industry events, including ComEd's Smart Grid Exchange Forum in Chicago.
column200: ComEd, the utility that serves over 4 million households in norther Illinois, agreed to a six month paid pilot with 6,400 customers.  This pilot has not launched yet, but it will launch at the beginning of the year.  We're also in talks with MC Squared, a competitive electricity supplier in Illinois, to use MeterGenius in a community with 70,000 households.
column201: Our next milestone will be our first revenue, and we expect to reach this milestone in Q1 2015.  We already have a commitment from ComEd for a pilot program worth $32,000.  How ever, we hope to land a much larger deal with MC Squared.  This deal could generate over $3.5 million in revenue in the first year of the contract.  If we do secure the MC Squared contract, the program will not start until May 2015, but some initial revenue should come in before then.
column208: Our fundraising plans are based on whether or not we win a large contract in the next 3 months. If we win a large contract, worth over $250,000, we'll raise a larger round ($1-3 million) in order to build out our team and further develop the product. If we do not win a large contract, our only revenue will be the $32k from the ComEd pilot, so we'll need to raise about $200,000 to improve our product and win that first big contract. We hope to secure funding by April 2015.

Spycob helps professional sellers find branded products for resale by providing them with information about discounts of 50%+ from major U.S. fashion retailers like Nordstrom, Macy’s, Yoox, etc.
We discovered that some of our users, who spend up to 3 hours in the app, are also sellers on eBay with income from eBay being their primary income. They use our Spycob app/website to find fashion brands at deep discounts (80-90%) to resell them on eBay or other marketplaces. 
We had a conversation with eBay and agreed on the terms of cooperation. We are launching a pilot project with a view for Spycob to develop solution for eBay sellers.
We did pivot, agreed with eBay and PayPal about free users, so we don't need to spend money on marketing. And now we're looking for opportunity to raise money asap on building this solution for eBay sellers which we can monetise immediately after launch.

Proprietary spiders capture 50-99% discounts from major retailers on branded apparel and accessories in real time

- At HP I discovered electronics. I'm not an engineer but created my own VoIP server for a client demonstration and hacked a pre-release Windows Wifi driver to make it work on Ubuntu for a government's bid (Intel hadn't worked on the Linux version yet.)

- I left HP at the peak of the economic crisis to find a job in Digital Marketing. Without any previous experience I got a job at Novartis in their Marketing department where I helped to deploy a Multichannel CRM based on Salesforce. I drew the attention of Capgemini who decided to hire me.

column182: Tiesport is a web platform that helps professionals fulfil their ambitions by building up strong business networks through shared interests
column183:
Many talented people failed when trying to launch a new product, get a new job position, expand their business...this is it, fulfil their professional ambitions. This is because they have not developed a reliable contacts network in which they can get mentorship, exchange critical information, find professionals from different disciplines or help them increase their reputation.

The problem is that developing bonds with other people is hard due to a potential lack of trust or initial interest but...the same way we share our interest with our personal relationships (friends) in order to start building trust with them... why not sharing those same interests with other professionals so as to get a more closer professional relationship? Tiesport is the answer to this.

To make it possible, we do gather data from people’s background (Linkedin/Facebook) and then we start diagnosing their current contacts network. We provide them feedback on how to improve it and start suggesting activities with other professionals based on their preferences.

By collecting this information we are in a position to provide trust grades between users through a machine-learning algorithm. We assume that if someone is sharing time and an interest with other people with a certain frequency, these relationships have a higher grade that those we make online since the relationship becomes more personal.

In the end, users are able to develop a trustable contact networking map and also see their cont

column10: Social gifting service that helps users gift/receive the best possible gift
column16:
The giftSomethin' app that is an actual SOLUTION to the gifting requirement, not just a feature.

Problem
www.giftsomethin.com/deck/3.png
www.giftsomethin.com/deck/4.png
www.giftsomethin.com/deck/5.png

Solution Illustration
www.giftsomethin.com/demo/Gifting.jpg
www.giftsomethin.com/demo/giftSomethin.jpg
www.giftsomethin.com/demo/GroupGifting.jpg
www.giftsomethin.com/demo/GiftCardIntegration.jpg

The gifting requirement is pretty dynamic.
The consumer can sometimes afford the gift, sometimes he can't.
She/he sometimes wants to create a group gift, sometimes he doesn't.
Sometimes she/he wants to gift money, sometimes not.

For these situations, the consumers are swarmed with apps/sites that provides these features, individually. 
You cant expect the customer to use one app/site for wedding registry, one for baby registry, one for gift card, one for creating a group gift and so on. This type of requirement requires a SOLUTION to the consumer rather than apps/sites for individual features. 
Regardless of what the requirement/situation the customer is in, he should have a go-to app/site for it; instead of having to go through multiple apps/sites.

giftSomethin' is the SOLUTION to this requirement.

giftSomethin' will provide ease of access - everything gift related will be available within this app.

The consumer will not have to download multiple app for various operations like gifting, giftcards, group gifting etc.

She/he also does not have to have a different app or go to a different site to create a wedding registry, baby registry etc.

giftSomethin' is a go-to app for everything gift related. 

Future
www.giftsomethin.com/deck/18a.png
www.giftsomethin.com/deck/18b.png
www.giftsomethin.com/deck/18.png

Like how, today, we have shopping -> Amazon; music -> iTunes, Spotify, movies -> Netflix, videos -> Youtube, we aim to be gifts -> giftSomethin.
column17: giftSomethin' is the SOLUTION to the gifting requirement.

column183:
We're building an app that caters to all the gifting needs of the customer. 
We're not providing any individual feature, but instead, providing a complete solution.
- Users can create a personal profile & add other users as contacts (like a social network)
- They can send and receive gifts between the contacts in their networks.
- They can also pool in with other contacts to create a group gift.
- They can create Wishlist (and registries) & browse others' wishlist to see what they want. This way, gifting becomes easier and people actually get what they want. 
- Additionally, the users can post photos and videos of their celebrations thus creating an online gallery/album of all the important moments in life. 
(Your memories wont get lost in the crazy photos of selfies, friendship/inspirational-thoughts, Rajnikanth/Chuck Norris jokes, food pics etc)
