column182: Teachers Plus is a professional development social learning platform for coaching technology integration to educators
column183:
A social learning platform that will empower today’s teachers through integrating technology into their classrooms. The platform’s content delivery strategy is based on the idea of social networking, which combines collaboration, sharing and gamification. 
Teachers will be able to register through their Educational Institution and interact with their colleagues through our platform. They will be able to work in groups when learning about new Information Technology tools and how to integrate them in the 21st Century classroom.

The platform will host engaging and interactive eLearning material based on the UNESCO ICT-CFT (The ICT CFT is a framework that outlines the competencies that teachers need to integrate Information and Communication Technologies (ICTs) into their professional practice).
Our platform promises the effective content delivery and coaching to teachers by considering each of the themes identified in research.

The platform will provide an intelligent rewarding system for educators they will receive scores and badges on the quality of their work on the platform also a trick to encourage everyone contribution - the user can not progress in the course unless he adds a contribution to the system and receives at least one review, and all the users on the system will not be able to progress unless they complete their To-Do list, The To-Do List will contain items like, your peer Jack added a contribution, give him some feedback.

column182: Developing a solution for distraction-free driving by selectively disabling functions and apps of the mobile phone when in driver's seat.
column183:
Statistics shows that on an average, one life is lost every two hours and an economic loss of approximately $30MM is incurred due to distracted driving. At least 26% of all crashes involved drivers either texting or talking on their mobile phones while driving. Our goal is to develop an affordable solution for distraction-free driving, while not hindering the benefits of the mobile phone.

From the outset, we found a new application for existing technology with relatively minor modifications. This strategy enables us in faster product cycle resulting in quicker entry into the markets, a key advantage for the entrepreneur and investors.  

We successfully developed a prototype utilizing readily available hardware that is currently used for different applications in different sectors. By appropriately modifying, we were able to tailor the hardware to reuse for this specific application. The complete solution includes an RF transmitter that communicates with our app on the phone. The solution differentiates between the driver and the passenger resulting in the ability to engage the driver's mobile phone only. The end-users will have the opportunity to disable (texting, calling) and enable (maps, emergency calls) various functions . It provides the ability to reconfigure the non-safe (driver's seat) and safe areas within the car. The total cost of the product to the company is less than $26. We are currently working on reducing this price to less than $12.
column185: Our current status includes a developed prototype with intellectual property (provisional) in place. We anticipate entering the market in mid 2015 with our first product - a standalone system. We anticipate launching a second product in early 2016, with more functionality that can generate individual driving profiles. Simultaneously, we would like to start hardware development. To achieve these milestones, we need guidance in terms of strategy development, hiring staff and raising capital.

column182: Maki is a mobile application that allows customers of restaurants to browse the menu, make orders, and view and pay their bill.
column183:
Maki is a mobile application that allows customers of restaurants to browse the menu, make orders, and view and pay their bill all from their phone. We've also created an intuitive bill splitting functionality that makes it convenient for diners to split the bill with their friends. 

The app allows two-way syncing with the restaurant POS, making it "unobtrusive" (like JS on a web page). In other words, a customer could use Maki to browse the menu to see popular dishes, specials, and past orders, then order through the waiter, then track the order on Maki and pay using Maki when they're done. What amakes it easy is that our application is deployed from the cloud, it doesn't require any technicians or engineers to physically install the program in the restaurant and the POS system can be seamlessly integrated.

The main problems this app solves is wasted time waiting (up to ~20 mins per table turnover) & settling the bill on the customer side It also reduced high labor costs on the restaurant side (which amounts to ~30% of total revenue). As we've shown this product to restaurant owners and customers, our team has received very strong validation (often, we'll get calls several days later with comments like "I was out eating today and totally would've loved to use your app to {pay | browse | order}". Considering this, Maki is a solution to multiple pain points on the restaurant & customer side of the dining experience.

column197: For Maki, will use a hybrid business model which meets restaurants needs relative to their respective type. Independent locations prefer performance based pricing, we will implement a transaction fee of 5% per transaction. On the other hand, chain locations prefer a fixed subscription, so we will implement a subscription fee of $29 per table per month. These fees are tentative until we exit our pilot program phase and we have the opportunity to conduct a full pricing analysis on data collected.

column182: FreightGrid is a SaaS web-application that helps users manage their LTL freight, cutting freight costs and saving time.
column183: With the advancement of new technology, web rating engines, and advanced routing solutions, the value of a broker for both the carrier and the shipper has been greatly reduced, but brokers are still widely used.   FreightGrid has built a solution that empowers shippers to take their freight management in-house and eliminate the need to use a broker.  By charging a low, flat monthly rate and offering a rich feature set that takes the difficulty out of trying to manage all the different facets of sending and receiving LTL freight and provides shippers everything they need to negotiate directly with carriers, FG is positioned to change the way small to midsize manufacturers send LTL freight.  FG manages all of a user's customer and freight data, and gets smarter the more it is used.  Features: Shipping includes pulling rates from multiple carriers onto one screen, automating and aggregating email rate requests, creating all necessary shipping documents, and sending notices to the carrier and consignee.  The tracking functionality allows users to manage both their inbound and outbound shipments and easily communicate with customers and suppliers.  FG also provides a wealth of reporting and analytics which are essential for negotiating good rates on an ongoing basis.  FG is also seeing a prime opportunity to white-label our software and offer it to carriers.  FG is currently working on implementing a solution with St. Louis based LTL carrier CRH Transport.

column16:
Cast is the premier, real-time polling platform - gaining intelligence by giving voice to the people, brands and communities we serve. Our mobile technology integrates with Twitter, Facebook and existing mobile applications of sports brands, allowing them to create and share micro polls instantly across their entire social networks. Polls can be one of four structured types of questions - either public or private for followers.

Version 2.0 of our technology, set to be released at the end of August, will be an increased value-add for sports brands as it will provide integration with existing mobile apps of pro sports teams as well as the ability to project poll questions across a variety of mediums such as scoreboards, television, etc. These updates will position our business as a SAAS model to begin generating revenues at the pro team or league level in the very near future.

Version 3.0 of our technology will allow us to provide back-end data analysis to our customers as well as a rewards platform to incentivize fan engagement. Our analysis will leverage demographic data and user responses to provide meaningful data and marketing intelligence to teams, as well as open new revenue channels for any brands utilizing our platform.

column182: Cast provides marketing intelligence and customer rewards via our mobile live polling app which integrates with existing social networks.
column183:
Existing social networks such as Twitter or Facebook have clumsy or unstructured methods of gauging instant social opinion. Similar to Vine, our free mobile polling application integrates with these applications and allows users to create and share micro polls across their entire social networks instantly.  Our application provides an immersive experience that has seen strong user growth considering we have not launched a formal marketing program.

While there are competing live polling tools in the enterprise and social spaces, we are differentiating ourselves by improving how brands interact with and learn about their customer base.  Because approximately 90% of our users register for our application using their Twitter or Facebook credentials, we can leverage a user's demographic data and cross reference it with their responses to Cast poll questions to provide meaningful data and instant market research to brands desiring a better return on their digital marketing efforts.

How can we effectively grow and retain our user base?  By aligning with key social media content producers with significant, loyal networks and by allowing brands to offer rewards for answering micro polls within the app. Brands can offer discounts, special promotions, or giveaways to users who answer micro polls.  Users can accumulate rewards from their favorite brands simply by answering questions.   

We will be in the business of accumulating, refining, and selling marketing intelligence to brands.

column196:
Cast was created after seeing brands/individuals leverage social tools such as Twitter and Facebook to poll their audiences. The problem is that these platforms were not created specifically for questions & answers. Cast is a dedicated experience that integrates with existing social circles.

In the past year, several similar apps have been released including ThreeCents, Voice, and Thumb. However, these apps do not have a brand/reward focus, which is where our core revenue model is built around.
column197:
Our target customers will be any brands with a strong social media presence and an innovative interest in new ways of learning about and growing their customer base. At this stage, we envision making money in three ways:

1) Fees from brands who offer rewards to users for answering polls.
2) Fees from brands who purchase raw data streams from the company related to their polls.
3) Fees from brands who desire more formal, structured reports with interpretive results related to their polls.
column198:
For sports teams in the digital world, we are finding that if you can get one team to show positive results from a new feature or product, they will often refer it to the league-wide offices for potential greater distribution.  We have been working on pilot programs with the St. Louis Blues and the St. Louis Rams as a result.

For non-sports brands, we will reach chief marketing officers and digital marketing teams using social media advertising and strategic marketing targeted to those groups.
column200: We are pre-revenue and are seeking pilot partners currently.  However, our app is available in the iOS store and we have seen nice growth in free users based solely on word of mouth.  In addition, we reached a contract with Darren Rovell, a national ESPN sportswriter, to join our advisory board and use Cast as his sole live polling tool on Twitter to grow our free user base nationally.
column201:
Our milestones for the next 6-9 months are primarily product-focused until we have completed several pilot programs to gauge effectiveness of the platform and to grow the existing free user base.  Following are the core milestones of that plan:

1) Improvements to the existing iOS/web app (anonymous voting/"nearby" technology/embeddable polls)
2) Integration with existing applications for two current pilot partners
3) Development of minimum viable reporting dashboard for brands (customers) to analyze trends and analysis
4) Development of minimum viable user profiles and rewards platform
5) Development of back end data analysis reporting structure for distribution to customers.
6) Acquisition and execution of pilot programs with 3-5 partners to test and refine #3, #4, and #5 above.
7) Significantly grow existing free user base via content and grassroots marketing efforts.
8) Continued development of Android application.

In addition, we received $50,000 as winners of the Arch Grants contest.  If necessary, after validating the product through several pilot customers, we would envision a larger angel round of $500,000-$1,000,000 to support a full marketing program and to carry the business to positive operating cash flows.
column209: Our greatest challenge is free user acquisition and retention. This is a process we are testing and improving currently, especially as it relates to a user's experience on Twitter and Facebook.

column182: We detect and prevent fraud against consumers and businesses.
column183: We created a system that detects 25 elements of fraud in a financial transaction and reduce losses from fraud to consumers and businesses.It notifies the police when fraud is detected including a picture of the suspect sent to the police car. We link businesses, consumers, and law enforcement to a national database that prevents fraud in real time. This has the capability of reducing ID Theft, check fraud, internet fraud, and debit/credit card fraud by 85%. When a financial transaction makes it through our system, we electronically transfer the funds to the business eliminating bank runs. The system also puts businesses in compliance with the Dodd- Frank Act, the Federal Trade Commission Red Flags Rule, and the regulations of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.It will also provide immediate reporting of fraud to law enforcement and submission of fraud incidents to local, state, and federal fraud victim databases. All participating businesses will have access to nationwide information that protects them from fraud crimes. The system will also give consumers the opportunity to make financial transactions just by using their thumb or index finger. They will have nationwide access and protection because the system verifies their identity. Any incident of ID Theft, Check Fraud, Internet Fraud, debit/credit card fraud,lost or stolen ID will be reported in real time. The overall benefit is that this system will reduce funds for drug trafficking and terrorism.

column182: ZinkUz provides an easy and simple way to start new friendships within an organization.
column183: A recent employee engagement survey found that only 20% of employees are engaged at work. Negative employee engagement costs corporate America $550 billion a year. Gallup Organization reports, "those who have a best friend at work are seven times more likely to be engaged. Gallup found that close work friendships boost employee satisfaction by 50%."  ZinkUz simply connects random people together within organizations to start new friendships. ZinkUz provides a simple and easy way to connect to people within the boundaries of an organization. People can easily expand their friendships at work, school and church. One example on how Zinkuz can be embraced by employees is to, "Do Lunch Different". Instead of eating lunch alone or with the same co-workers, employees would use ZinkUz to be connected to other co-workers to eat lunch with. We call it "Do Lunch Different" Why didn't we use the word, "differently" - because we are just different at ZinkUz. ZinkUz strengthens organizations by creating new friendships within.  ZinkUz reduces poor employee engagement & lowers attrition. ZinkUz increases innovation, creativity and ultimately increases profits. CEO magazine came out with this article, "Tim Cook Likes to Eat Lunch With Random Apple Employees In The Cafeteria"

column182: we are an online work management platform that helps businesses get 25% more productive through effective data collaboration & workflows
column183:
CollaborateCloud helps companies get productive through effective data collaboration & workflows management. Typically, companies use spreadsheets or other off the shelf products to manage their business data but these tools cannot be customized to the specific needs of the company. Managing workflows through emails & phone calls are very ineffective. 

CollaborateCloud through its unique drag & drop app builder allows teams to create their own tools & workflows to streamline any business function. Teams can setup their own custom sales processes, project management processes, recruitment processes and so on. It provides agility to teams to quickly create what they need without having it custom developed through an IT team. 

CollaborateCloud puts teams back in control of their work tools & workflows, not the other way around. It connects people, processes & information bringing them under a single platform to facilitate work.

column182: We enable retailers to participate in the journey of their customers as they go from online to offline in making considered purchases.
column183:
We've built a shopping tool that enables furniture retail customers to walk away with a virtual collection of the products they view in-store or online. These customers typically do not buy in-store or online their first visit as these larger, more considered purchases usually require thought, feedback from friends/family/designers/experts, and price comparison. Customers can create "collections" (similar to wish lists) from a retailer's online or physical store and share them with their group of friends and family, where all of the participants can then make comments and add products to that "collection" from any other online retailer. It's a fun and easy multi-channel shopping experience for retail customers. It increases conversion to sales from customers that usually leave without buying on an online or store visit their first time, increases order size, and gives retailers insight into potential future purchases that leads to a larger lifetime value of a customer.

The retailer is able to participate in the shopping journey and can then appropriately insert themselves in that conversation through recommendations, or offering various perks such as discounts or access to an expert designer. The experience is fun and easy for the customers and the benefits to the retailer include increased conversion and order size, more email addresses in the CRM, reduced cart abandonment, and competitive insight.

column11: Mobile,Social Networking,Event,Event Management,Event Planning,Lead Generation,Location Based Services,Trade Shows,Community,Community Building,Community Outreach,Community Relations,Event Marketing,Ticket Sales,Job Search,Business Development,Mobile Applications,Consumer Internet,Web,Consumer
column16:
PROsimity is an app that helps you discover relevant events and people nearby, so that you can make the right connections.

Users swipe up to connect with other people that appear interesting. If both users want to network, they can instantly chat, connect via LinkedIn, meet, and start building a relationship.
Similarly users can find out about business events, see who’s planning to go, swipe up an event to join, purchase tickets, or start communicating with attendees ordered by relevance and common grounds.  

In order to decide which people and events to display first, our algorithm takes into account business similarities (based on LinkedIn), relevancy (based on user’s filters and search), location, time, and event attendance. The result is a very accurate list of people and events that are the most relevant for the user.

Event organizers can now sync their Eventbrite accounts (we are an official Eventbrite partner), allowing an easy, fully automatic import of their current and future events to be featured on PROsimity.    

Aimed to increase members-engagement, our community/group features allow community-owners to stay in-touch with their members, promote events, make announcements and let members of the same community connect with each other as well as discover other members they’ve never met. 
In fact, we strongly believe that this could be a great solution for your own alumni network!

column85:
I was the 2nd hire at SweetIM where I served as the Product Manager & Growth Hacker (way before this term was invented).
During my time there our team grew the userbase from 0 to 100M users! 100M users that truly LOVED & used the product!

The amazing part is that we did it with a tiny seed investment & ZERO initial marketing budget (we only started spending on marketing when we figured out our user lifetime value. Way after launch)

In the early days most traffic came from automatic tools that I've created, which generated zero-cost downloads. Later on we've added some smart viral features, which we constantly tweaked & improved, while keeping the balance between aggressiveness vs. effectiveness.

But of course that's not enough, it was our ability to understand & deliver what users wanted, that made it so successful.

Hard to explain what it feels to build a product that reaches so many people in so many places and cultures.
One thing for sure - I plan to do it again with PROsimity!
column182: PROsimity connects you with professionals you should meet before, during, and after networking events.
column183:
Despite the effectiveness of event networking for lead generation and value creation purposes, there is currently a huge waste of resources, since business networking today is mostly based on luck and/or lengthy preparation time. 73% of event organizers in the US do not use software solutions to enhance attendees’ ROI and the solutions out there are suboptimal. In absence of solutions, most professionals today attend networking events knowing they might leave empty handed.
PROsimity is a mobile app that, through API crawling and crowdsourcing, aggregates networking events of all sizes occurring within the mile radius selected by the user.  By joining an event community the user can see who else is going, with those most relevant showing first, based on specific criteria the user is looking for and the common grounds with others. The user can then invite to connect those he wants to meet, and PROsimity makes an introduction if they are both interested. The users can then add to LinkedIn, chat and set up meetings from the app. With PROsimity the user can decide in seconds whether an event is worth his time, and connect with the people he should meet there, before, during or even after the event.
column185: We want to get the product ready for launch, and we want to fine tune our growth and business strategy.
column186:
Riccardo Pisano-CEO. Product development at PROsimity. Riccardo is a software engineer with an M.S. in e-commerce and information systems technology. He has been building software since 2002.

Gretel Echarte- COO. Business Development at PROsimity. Gretel is an attorney in both the US and Spain. While earning her law school degrees she worked as a store manager, sales manager, and marketing campaign coordinator.
column188:

He also founded GeoWinks, a location based dating app which reached over 7,500 users within a few months, after which Riccardo decided to solve a more compelling problem and started working on PROsimity. At Geowinks Riccardo worked on product and business development.

Gretel worked at GeoWinks providing legal support and assisting in business development and marketing strategy.

column195:
Our focus is different. Our customer interviews show that there's an unmet need. While our competitors are focused in connecting event attendees only at large events around the world, we focus on building communities of professionals around local events of all sizes on a year round basis under one single platform.
Our business and growth strategy are different too. We won't charge event organizers unless they require custom features. We will use cross-promotion partnerships to grow our user base
column196:
Bizzabo.com- Focuses on high end conferences. We focus on local events of all sizes. 
Doubledutch.me, Crowdcompass.com, Attendify.com- White label apps for events. We want to build one single platform with our brand. 
Meetup.com- Events of all kinds based on groups. We focus on business networking and don't charge organizers for promoting their events, since we want our app to be as comprehensive as possible with local events and are using event organizers as our promotion platform.
column197: Although the existing version will be free for organizers, we will license PROsimity and charge for higher levels of customization with prizes ranging from $99-$4999. We will later through event organizers distribute a premium version for exhibitors that will boost their lead retrieval rates on a single event basis while increasing the organizer's revenue. Once we reach a critical mass, we will sell a sales version to businesses. Later on we will also generate revenue through B2B ads.
column198: Partnering with event organizers, local organizations, chambers of commerce and universities.  We also have viral loops built into the app, like event sharing, or invites. We have 1,083 users and 33,500 invites, so in average one user refers the app to 33 contacts.

Introducing what is seen to be fairly novel technology in most people's eyes comes with a number of challenges. Foremost one is removing the mental block that people have in relation to how texting is, and how it should be. People are resistant to change. It's hard for them to snap out of something they have been doing 1 way for over 2 decades. 

Framing - showing RT to be as nonthreatening and easy to get into as possible
Curiosity - it is important to pique the users interest in order for them to explore this new opportunity
Advantage - show the potential or acquired user asap the benefits of using RT vs TB

RealTalk will revolutionize an industry that is stuck in superficial rut, RealTalk will challenge users to showcase their personalities and uniqueness in a 60 second video chat, once the chat is over the users can decide if they'd like to match, once they become a match they can continue communicating through our in app messaging.

RealTalk is different than traditional dating/friend-finding apps/websites, as we allow users to meet face-to-face without having to browse accounts. Our goal is cut out the repetitive of process that you find on apps such as Tinder, where you can potentially have 100's of matches and have to go through the same small talk with all of them:

As users of other dating applications, we've grown tired and frustrated with the mundane process of filtering through picture/profiles of people that may or may not look or be like their profile says.

RealTalk is here to provide authenticity and provide users with that WOW factor that no one offers and bring that into the online dating world.

At CareerStarter, we help growing companies get great candidates through our unique pre-interview skills-based assessments. With these assessments, you are able to request from applicants, relevant skill samples in the form of video, audio, work-sample or all three. These samples are short "first glimpse" assessments that gets right down to the skills for the job.

This allows you to get a better look at the candidate before you bring them in for an interview. You can also share those work-samples with key decision makers of your choosing. They can also rate and comment on these samples, and then send their feedback privately back to you.

column196: Our competitors include: jobon, sparkhire, rivs, and hirevue. These companies like to use video for their interviewing process. So companies are still having to spend an hour long speaking with the candidate even if it is over video. We feel companies do not need an hour to see if that person will be a good fit or not. So we take that video and shorten it to 1-2 minutes. This allows companies to get that first impression of the candidate and not have to waste their time pretending to like them.

We have two revenue models.

-Companies who are hiring all the time. We have a monthly subscription fee.

column10: TempoRun syncs your run with your music, making running fun!

column182: TempoRun makes running easier and more enjoyable by organizing the music on your phone by tempo so you can always run to the beat of your mu
column183:
We like to think of our selves as a legal performance enhancer. 

The Problem: 
•	Running is hard
•	For many it’s unenjoyably
•	Music is a big part of a runners routine, but running at the wrong tempo will actually strain your run
•	Organizing music by tempo is extremely difficult

The Solution:

We are fixing this. TempoRun is an app that allows users to always run at a consistent and enjoyable pace, using music’s tempo as a guide for their runs. A user simply downloads our app from the App Store and it automatically scans and categorizes all the music on their phone by tempo, so they can always match their feet to the beat while they run. 

How It Works: 

People love TempoRun so much because of its intuitive design. Our app categorizes a user’s music library on their smartphone into different levels, 1-10, based on tempo, similar to a treadmill. When running on a certain tempo level, every song will be close to the same beats per minute (bpm), or tempo. A user can match their running pace to this beat to create a more fluid and exhilarating running experience. Level 1 is a walking pace (slow tempo), level 5 is a jog (medium tempo), and level 10 is a fast sprint (fast tempo). This system is easy for runners to understand and use because it really is like taking a treadmill with you wherever you run. 

We also collect all relevant running stats needed by runners. Every time someone engages in a run, our app will track their distance, pace, and calories burned!
column185: We have many incredible future plans and revenue streams, but want to make sure we implement them in the perfect way. The only way to do this is to seek help and mentorship from others, and Capital Innovators is known to be one of the best mentorship accelerators out there. Our goal after completing Capital Innovators is to release/be close to releasing our 2.0 version. This includes in app purchases in the form of interval workouts and a streaming tempo radio, as well as an in app reward system

column182: CitySlooth provides an easy way for merchants to promote and deliver events, specials, and coupons to consumer’s mobile devices.
column183:
CitySlooth is a mobile-enabled website that provides an inexpensive way for any business or organization to promote its events, daily specials, coupons, and featured products and services, allowing consumers to see what is happening around them, at any time, for free.  

CitySlooth has two goals: to provide the small business and non-profit an easy, inexpensive online marketing tool for promoting timely content; and to create a highly searchable, geocentric tool for finding out what is happening anytime and anywhere.   CitySlooth alerts subscribers to special opportunities just a few doors away, and also shows them everything that is going on within range of a specific location.  Publishers can update their promotions at any time, and even track conversions in real time.  CitySlooth is completely free to subscribers.

With a flat monthly fee of $50 for businesses, CitySlooth is well below the cost of traditional marketing, such as mailers or print ads, which cost at least several times that for minimal exposure.

Real estate agents will use CitySlooth as a way to build long-term relationships with both residents and businesses in the areas they serve.  We will leverage our national network of real estate schools and companies to find licensees in other markets as we expand across the country.
column185: Ultimately, we need seed funding. While we are confident in our product, our business plan and pitch still lacks the refinement necessary to attract early stage investors.  We expect this program will not only help us greatly refine these, but also introduce us to experts in multiple disciplines.

We are measuring individual clicks and views to determine the value to our audience, as well as the number of subscribers to determine overall potential.
column201: We are currently in the pre-revenue stage. Our plan is to generate rich consumer content so that we can build an active consumer base; this will make CitySlooth more attractive as a fee-based marketing program for small businesses.  We plan to have a subscriber base of 500 consumers by the end of 2014, using a combination of social media and word-of-mouth promotions, as well as weekly contests to encourage new subscriptions. At the same time, we are reaching out to businesses and organizations in the St. Louis area to try CitySlooth for free during our launch. We expect to reach early revenue by the end of Q1 2015, with 1000 consumers and 100 active business publishers. We will engage real estate agents in neighborhoods around St. Louis to use CitySlooth as their marketing vehicle. While this will help build both our consumer and business base, we believe we will need to augment this with a commissioned sales force in order to reach our future milestones on time.
column208: We are looking for $75,000 of seed capital to launch in St. Louis.  While our current plan indicates that business can sustain itself as we add licensees in other markets, we may seek additional capital in order to expedite national expansion.
column209: At this time, our biggest struggle is with reaching potential business publishers. With a commissioned sales force, we could get our message to a larger number of small businesses in a shorter amount of time.  However, we do not currently have funding available for salespeople, and are therefore relying on inexpensive and less reliable promotional methods.

column10: Wholesale parts distributor for cell phone repair shops nationwide
column16:
In 2014 the cell phone repair industry was a $4B market and still growing. Need Fixed Parts may sound boring, but we supply parts to repair shops across the country. We offer the highest quality of parts to ensure customer satisfaction, matched with unparalleled customer service. We found a gap in the market where our competition offers lower quality parts, resulting in more customer returns and a lack of trust. 

Our goal is to become the #1 supplier in the U.S. for wholesale distribution of parts to repair shops. We've already built some strong partnerships with some of the biggest companies in the industry and we're not done yet. We know we can become the #1 supplier in the U.S. without any hesitation as we scale.

column182: Love Will Inc. develops blockchain based financial tools including our bitcoin wallet Pheeva, allowing fast, secure, low cost transactions.
column183: Traditional financial systems are slow, inefficient and costly. Block-chain technology eliminates much of this friction, allowing for fast, digital, peer-to-peer transfer of assets. Our first block-chain based application, Pheeva, is a mobile bitcoin wallet that enables individuals and businesses to send money to anywhere in the world, instantaneously and at no cost. The Pheeva mobile bitcoin wallet combines a sleek interface with a robust backend to provide world-class user experience, security, and reliability. Its simple design makes sending and receiving bitcoin intuitive for all transactions and balance inquiries. By eliminating the currently steep learning curve associated with bitcoin, Pheeva is poised to become the “go-to” mobile Bitcoin wallet. In addition we are developing block-chain based reward programs and cashless payments systems that use the revolutionary technology behind bitcoin without its risk and volatility. These highly scalable products allow business districts, towns, or even whole cities to implement cost effective and flexible reward programs. These programs offer a 2-3% advantage over credit card fees, custom in-app promotional tools, and detailed consumer analytics, all within your mobile device. The backbone of all of these applications is the blockchain, which allows fast, transparent, transaction of value across a decentralized network at a small fraction of the cost.
column184: You can download the Pheeva wallet for iOS, Android, and Chrome extension or visit Pheeva.com for more information.
column185: We have acquired over 3200 unique users in four months and earned our spot as the preferred wallet of BitPay, the largest bitcoin payment processor in the world, all with zero funding or marketing expenses. We need sginificant financial support for our marketing campaign, upcoming TV commercial, and college tour. We also hope to gain insight from Capital Innovators excellent mentors about how to proceed and organize our company, as well as gain valuable connections within the St. Louis community

column10: Just finished Launchcode's CS50 class
column182: This is a scalable suite of web apps that enhances and measures interpersonal relationships within organizations or more spontaneous groups.
column183:
Learning Management Systems, like Edx.org, and Human Resources technology offers new avenues to teach, train and measure people, but the abstractions necessary to communicate knowledge and measure performance online limits social interaction within these systems.  The convergence of fast internet and mobile technologies provide people with  enhanced abilities to interact In Real Life (IRL) and virtually.  Gaming and real-time responsiveness in web and mobile technologies offer new kinds of social interactions to abstract into the online environment.  We can do a better job of using technology to enhance our social interactions, rather than abstracting them.

I am creating a platform to help groups work together more effectively.  Cloud-based apps which teach, enhance, manage and measure interpersonal relationships can use real-time web and mobile technology in novel ways, which bring proven IRL techniques online.  Essentially, my platform would virtualize the leadership training exercises that have tradionally been used by consultants, militaries, teachers and camp counselors.  Initially, my platform would consist of two parts.  First, a team building game that virtualizes a training technique I used as a raft guide to quickly build synergy in a group of 3-7 people.  Second, an app that provides optimized interpersonal communication techniques.  The latest reactive programming methods create opportunities to implement these lessons because they rely on real-time feedback.

The design for the technology comes from my real-life experience as a raft guide, an experiential education teacher and a student at the National Outdoor Leadership School.  It also comes from experiencing learning in a MOOC, CS50x.  The content of the course and my experiences did a good job of sparking my imagination to see how technology could be used to add value to group learning.

My experience makes me uniquely suited to design and promote this product.

column10: I help authors get global visibility to market their books.
column11: Creative Development,Innovative Thinking,,Publishing,Books,Organizing,Application Design,Marketing Solutions,Marketing Effectiveness,Social Media Marketing,Social Entrepreneurship,Editing,Coaching
column182: Bookarma is a revolutionary new platform where authors help other authors market their books globally through shared social media.
column183:
Book discovery is difficult to achieve and authors have many choices with various price points to accomplish this monumental task. Their options range from Facebook campaigns, Google AdWords, informal alliances with other authors, LinkedIn Groups, and more expensive options like hiring a publicist and paying for radio and television interviews. No matter what combination of options they employ, the recognized best practice is to gain a following and market through social media.

Bookarma is unique because it allows authors to go beyond the boundaries of their own social circles and reach readers in other circles. Authors on the Bookarma platform share books written by other authors with their followers, and other authors do the same for them. In doing so, all authors expand their reach beyond what they could achieve on their own. They touch a global audience without having to cultivate that audience themselves.

Our belief that Bookarma was unique was validated in May 2014, at BEA in New York and again in October 2014, at the Frankfurt Book Fair. The most common reaction from the top professionals in the industry continues to be, “This is brilliant. I’ve never seen anything like it.”

column182: HCC extends a dairy cow's productive life by 2-3 lactations through modulating its mucosal immunity & microbiota of the reproductive tract.
column183:
HealthyCow is a biotech for the dairy industry. Our products improve and optomize a cow's metabolism and microbiom to maximize health, immunity, and productivity. The end goal is to extend productive life of a cow & improve dairy producer economics.

ProMunity: Augments the animal's immune system enabling it to fight off infectious agents. It is addressing the fields of managing metabolic disorders and antimicrobials. Ultimately, direct and indirect competition is extensive which covers mineral replacement therapies, antibiotics, and vaccines.

ProPreg: Augments the microbiota of the animal to improve reproductive success. Competition is thinner in the field of fertility since the main products on the market are hormonal synchronization, mineral supplement, antibiotics (to address uterine infections) and services to improve fertility success. There are no direct direct competitors to ProPreg. Furthermore, ProPreg can be used in conjunction with existing therapies, thus complimenting existing products.

HCC has a large vision to develop and implement a "complete system" that addresses dairy cow health. Combined with ProPreg and ProMunity, HCC will eventually develop a point-of-care handheld diagnostic tool. This tool will function as a complimentary diagnostic to enable producers to monitor the prognosis and health status of the cow, especially related to the biomarkers HCC products are modulating to optimize cow health.
column184: We have scientific peer-reviewed publications that demonstrate our products' effectiveness in over 200 dairy cows.

column182: Deehubs is social network where users post in streets, on digital billboards. The first social network connecting online and physical world.
column183:
There are people in the world who want to say something meaningful and important. Sometimes Facebook friends or Twitter Followers are not enough to spread your voice across the world. 

Deehubs is social network where people directly post on public screens (indoor and outdoor billboards). It is new communication channel where users have access to thousands of people walking in the streets. All you need to do is to download Deehubs mobile app. It's like Twitter but connected to Deehubs billboards. So you create content and your messages, videos and pictures appear in streets in real time. 

Deehubs is not only effective solution for people but also for billboards. Today world knows four major screens: Mobile, TV, Computer and Electronic Billboard. Three out of these four are booming because here we have social content + advertisement. Billboards are boring because they are all about ads. Deehubs makes them engaging by bringing social content.
column185: Our software is already ready. We will use your investment to put first Deehubs public screen and to fully launch our product.

column195:
Everyone thinks billboard is just for advertisement. Many try to build interactive billboards but all of them first focus on advertisers and only after that on regular users. Thus every activity is just one time marketing campaign and no one ends up with retained user base.

We do everything other way around. We are first socially conscious company in outdoor advertisement industry. So we are building user base around billboards that opens doors to analytics and makes our screens smarter.
column196: Our biggest competition comes from traditional electronic billboards, which just show 24 hour video commercials. Here major public screen owners are Clearchannel, JCDecaux and CBS Outdoor. Deehubs' billboard advantage is first high engagement because of the rich content and second ad prices on our screens are lower because of our diversified revenue model.
column197:
We monetize on advertisement and users messages. 

Together with social messages Ads still stay on Deehubs Billboard for 24 hour just appearance is different. Brands will be able to place targeted and keyword commercials, they can reply to each message of users. 

In addition of that Deehubs generated revenue from priced users posts. Messaging on billboard is free but if user wants to choose exact message display time (for example tomorrow at 12 pm) then he needs to pay for it.
column198:
We are unique startup while our billboards itself stands for our marketing and they are most effective advertising channel for us. 
Deehubs makes location targeting so we will put our screens in major cities, iconic streets, malls, restaurants and etc. After each new screen we will start location-based marketing through social media. 

To bring advertisment on our billboards we will partner with Media Agencies. We already showcased to Leo Burnett, Mediacom, Universal, OMD and Starcom.

About two years ago, ReVibe Energy was founded on the base of a promising technology who was in need of a market. We're not cash flow positive at this point, but having spent two years building our team, discussing with potential clients, signing our first customers and seeing our technology emerge from blueprints to prototypes I have to say that I'm immensely proud of what we have achieved.

MyResApp which stands for My Resume Application was founded in 2013 and uses technology, through a social media platform and a gaming module, to assist young adults, ages 16 through 24 and 25 in landing internships and full-time entry level positions with opportunities to earn a living wage. MyResApp’s overall mission is to connect students with opportunities through the digital platform that would enable them to gain working experience potentially leading to full time employment within organizations. While striving to build lasting relationships between the community and organizations seeking to hire entry-level workers.

We are also creating, in a later phase, a gaming/training simulator that will allow candidates to progress through “intern-like” activities that will allow them to arrive at an entry level job with pertinent “experience.”

column10: Automation for travel
column16:
Our algorithms ingest data from many sources (weather, facilities, terrain, traffic, prices) and identify where the best conditions for vacations and activities are with up to 4 months in advance.

In other words, we automate travel research, do it orders of magnitude better than any human expert and deliver it instantly on any platform - great opportunity on mobile.

This patented technology has many applications in travel search, distribution and revenue management.

We develop the technology and deliver it as a service to other companies - we are an enterprise software company and our first product is the Predictions API.

We launched on November 18th when we demonstrated on stage at the PhocusWright Travel Innovation Summit, the most premier event of the travel industry. Link to our pitch on stage: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HmEbawSNZRo

We are advised by executives from Expedia, T-Mobile, TUI Travel, Altus Alliance, Iunu and XTT Consulting.

Read about us in TechCrunch: http://techcrunch.com/2015/12/16/qalendra/
column39: Founder @Qalendra. Co-founded Merlin acquired by TBWA; created TBIEH acquired by Ermenegildo Zegna; founded ESMUS; BA in British Studies

column182: We make sure that active travelers, adventure seekers and festival goers have a most rewarding vacation.
column183:
Traditionally, the travel industry has been obsessed with the concept of end-destination. In a very geographical sense. It’s all about WHERE to go for a vacation.

But TIMING is particularly important when it comes to travel activities, festivals & events.

At Qalendra, we design algorithms that aggregate information from a variety of sources and identify the best time for each specific activity anywhere in the world.

As an example: by aggregating information about weather, geo-location, boat rentals, fish migration patterns and moon phases we can recommend the best time to go deep sea fishing anywhere in the world.

column195:
Qalendra ads a new dimension to today's online travel infrastructure: time.

We use the API layer of the Internet and our proprietary algorithms to identify and recommend the best time to travel for specific activities (like skiing, playing golf, skydiving, attending a festival or a sport event) anywhere in the world.

Also, we recommend accommodation nearby festivals venues, most convenient transportation and other activities to do while in location that match user's profile.
column196:
Top competitors: Gogobot, Wanderfly, TouristEye, travel companies that all got acquired in the last 2 years by Google, TripAdvisor or Lonely Planet.
All of them recommend relevant trips to travelers.
But none of them is a travel calendar.
The time dimension in today's online travel is completely missing.

Total adventure travel market is worth $263 billion – excluding airfare – and the average yearly increase in was of 65% from 2009 to 2012.
Addressable market: adventure travelers represent 47% of EU population (246 mil. individuals) and 16% of US population (50 mil.).

Affiliate sales: hotels (Expedia), flights (Skyscanner), activities (Viator)

column10: Cloud Based Software for Past Due Receivables Management
column16:
We are making a past due receivables management engine.  The system automates phone calls, letters, emails, sms messages and fax contact attempts based on defined work rules targeting small and midsized businesses and debt collection firms.  The debt collection market has an estimated 10,000 agencies and an estimated 13 billion dollars in revenue.  

We feel that is a huge untapped market for a secure and easy to use system to automate in house collection work especially for small and mid sized business.  Pretty much any company that extends credit to other businesses or consumers could use a system like ours.  We also want to make sure this system is secure and plan to offer PCI DSS Level 1 compliant and HIPAA compliant options for customers that need that level of security.
column17: We are focusing on bring an affordable past due invoice / receivables process to small businesses which we feel are an under served market.
column39: David is a Developer / Sys Admin with 12 yrs collection industry exp.
column46: For the last company I worked for I designed and built a 3000 line capable dialing cluster with custom import and export rules for the debt collection platform they used.  The system was powered by 12 asterisk telephony servers, 2 mysql database servers and 2 apache web servers.  It used Freeswitch as multi carrier least cost routing gateway.  This system saved the company tens of thousands of dollars a month between the reduced vendor fees and the lower telecom rates because it used the best rate (and if the call failed went to the next best rate and so on).
column52: A prior-service U.S. Marine Staff Sergeant with over 9 years of service
column59: During my nine years in the United States Marine Corps I served three combat tours in Iraq and held numerous billets including Combat Instructor, Martial Arts Instructor-Trainer and as an EA-6B Electronic Countermeasures Systems Technician. On my first deployment I invented a device to assist in servicing a very expensive and sensitive piece of equipment which saved myself and my fellow Marines countless hours of maintenance time in the field and potentially saved the taxpayer millions of dollars, for which I was awarded a Certificate of Commendation. I served with distinction rising to the rank of Staff Sergeant in just seven years and earned numerous personal awards to include two Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medals.
column182: We make a secure cloud based past due receivables management platform that focuses on generating contacts in regards to delinquent debt.
column183:
We are building a contact focuses system for debt collection.  We are going to cloud host the entire stack.  Web Application, Voice over IP phone system and Voice over IP Dialer systems.  These systems are all tightly integrated into the platform.  Currently nobody in the collection software industry has an entirely cloud based system that has the full stack of services integrated.  The system integrates, Click to call, Click to leave message, MMS messaging, click to fax (planned), click to mail letter (planned), and call recording all under 1 product.  We also plan to bring on predictive dialing later.

We are also going to target our customers differently.  Right now most of the systems have a high upfront cost and high monthly recurring costs.  Being a cloud bases system we are just going to charge the monthly fee.  Our focus is also going to be different.  We are going to focus on smaller companies and helping them set up an internal process for their collections and use our product to streamline their outsourcing.

The last part is we are going to focus our system on security.  We are going to run it off of AWS initially at least and we are going to be HIPPA / HITECH and PCI-DSS Level 1 complaint.  By doing this and controlling the entire stack that would fall within scope we should be able to make compliance for the companies using our service much easier.

Being a B2B company we are not expecting a fast growth trajectory so we are also looking for the initial investment to work full time on this (right now David is 75% time and Alex is about 20%).  We are also looking to secure additional funding after the program to be able to have enough resources to have the staff and money to get the security certifications.

column10: Passionate about using technology to enhance people's day-to-day lives.
column182: Exemplr is the first-ever iOS app to provide collectors a fun, easy and free way to verify the authenticity of their autographs.
column183:
We are currently developing an app for iOS and Android that provides sports fans, entertainment enthusiasts and memorabilia collectors an easy and free way to verify the authenticity of their collectibles via community consensus. 

1. The Problem

Two companies currently own the autograph authentication market. Unfortunately for collectors, these companies have been a constant subject of controversy since their inception. They often overcharge customers, hire staff who are less than familiar with the industry and authenticate unofficial items for high-volume customers, moving collectors to look for alternatives. 

In today's memorabilia industry, one person has the power to determine a collectible "fake", leaving the collector with no real recourse. 

2. The Solution

Exemplr aims to give collectors a voice in this conversation by providing an ever-expanding authentication tool that entrusts the community, over the power of few. 

Our system allows users to submit photos of their favorite collectibles and employ the collector community to vote the item up or down based on consistencies, flow, stroke, and other metrics of the respective autograph. This will be the foundation of forging a system where collectors self-authenticate their own items.

As the community grows, so does the database of community-curated autographs that consumers and collectors can view, favorite, share, and compare at any place and at any time.

column10: Automated Coaching Technology for Health, Fitness, & Sports Enthusiasts
column16:
Business Summary - FeedbacK Enterprise is developing mobile and online applications to provide automated coaching technologies for the over 270 Million people in the US who participate in sports and want to improve.  With FeedbacK’s Apps when a Do-It-Yourself Learner performs a motion he will receive instant automated coaching instruction via his mobile device.  Our applications use the latest computer vision and machine learning techniques, combined with the video functionality that is already part of our mobile device.  FeedbacK’s initial Apps are for Golf and as we grow we will move to additional markets including other sports, health, fitness, & lifestyle industries. 

Problem – FeedbacK's solutions are for sports participants who don’t want to hire a coach or use an App that only provides data.  FeedbacK’s mobile and online Apps represent a new approach to the health, fitness, sports & lifestyle industries by videoing a motion and providing automated coaching to help the Do-It-Yourself learner improve. 

We are all familiar with sensors and devices that capture data.  The current industry approach is to present that data in the form of dashboards.  The user must interpret the dashboard information and decide what is required to improve.  Unlike our competitors who provide data, FeedbacK’s Apps provide automated coaching instruction. We do this using the latest computer vision and machine learning techniques combined with leveraging the video functionality that is already part of our mobile devices.
The output of the process is automated instruction (not data), just as if a coach or personal trainer was with you, without the expense or scheduling.

Solution - The Automated Coaching Technology consists of three distinct Apps at increasing price points:
•	Collect (voice-controlled mobile app used to capture, review and share video);
•	Analyze (takes the video collected and delivers instruction in your browser at the click of a button); and
•	Instruct (delivers automated Instruction at your practice location using your mobile device).
The FeedbacK Automated Coaching Apps are developed for a particular sports (golf, baseball, tennis, basketball...) In fact, the Automated Coaching technology is adaptable to any activity requiring repeatable motion.
We have launched FeedbacK: Collect for golf - the first of the three Apps that comprise the Automated Coaching Technology.  FeedbacK: Analyze and Instruct for golf are in development.

column183:
FeedbacK: Collect (Golf) (Available on iOS & Android) 
Capture, review and share videos with a mobile device. Voice-controlled, hands-free technology captures and stores each swing as a separate video. User-friendly software enables swing review and annotation on mobile devices and in our mobile and online Clubhouses.
FeedbacK: Analyze (in R&D) 
Analyze your golf swing at the click of a button. First, collect your swing video using the FeedbacK Golf: Collect system. With the video uploaded to the online FeedbacK Clubhouse, use FeedbacK Golf: Analyze to receive written personalized coaching. The system uses Computer Vision technology to automatically detect the club head path and, using proprietary techniques, provides written instruction.
FeedbacK: Instruct (in R&D) 
Receive audible instruction at the driving range. FeedbacK Golf: Instruct blends Collect (technology) and Analyze (knowledge) to wirelessly deliver computer generated instruction within moments after a golf swing.

Our intellectual property is primarily related to using computer vision techniques coupled with proprietary algorithms to analyze video and convert into audible and written instruction. 

Areas of Expertise:
Video to Instruction - Computer vision with artificial intelligence
Sensor Data to Instruction - Data acquisition with artificial intelligence
Big Data to Instruction - Data Mining with artificial intelligence

We filed an application to register the mark “Feedback” and design, on February 7, 2014.

column182: Marid is a music platform that beautifully showcases the works of independent artists.
column183:
We're building a platform for independent / unsigned musicians (artists, engineers, producers, and songwriters) that beautifully showcases their works, like a portfolio (songs, videos, lyrics, and photos). There's nothing else like it. It's not just an amazing tool for musicians, but for music fans and professionals too (e.g. artist discovery).

Here's some of our differentiators:

* Portfolio. Marid focuses more on 'selling all of the artist' rather than specific works of theirs. Songs, Videos, Lyrics, and Photos (of independent / unsigned artists) all on one platform.

* Recommendation System.

* Visual Analytics. Amazing data visualizations built with D3.js.

* Better search. Allowing users to find artists with specific skills sets, in specific genres, in specific locations (and more) is ideal.

* Higher Quality Content. Moderators and allowing users to flag content, we will be able to maintain high quality works across the whole platform. Users with unfinished works or low quality music won't be posting content on our platform.

* Not a numbers game. There will be no public view counts, likes, following/follower counts, etc.

A location-based mobile marketplace for jobs/tasks and workers. We launched in 2012 have over 25K users and now in the process of re-launching. 

When local shops/restaurants have a vacancy, they put a postcard outside their window waiting for people to inquire within or pay anywhere ($99 /£50) even for hourly vacancies to post on some sites and some brands expect users to check their websites to find out about available vacancies within local stores.

column182: Bringing rich media engagement to marketers’ location-based mobile promotions
column183:
The CandyBAR marketing platform enables marketers to easily combine the visual impact of Augmented Reality with location-based activities to deliver relevant promotional messages at exactly the right time and place. 

Candy Lab’s code-based mobile platform, CandyBAR, enables rapid development of custom-branded mobile apps to power events, tourism and civic pride. The patent-pending platform uses rich media, location-based engagement, and augmented reality to immerse users and drive them to intended locales. The result is unmatched user engagement through longer and more frequent interaction with branded assets, delivering a higher ROI than other marketing investments

Rather than simply focus on technological feature advancement, we began the development of CandyBAR from the perspective of our customers - Marketers and Business Owners. Our objective was to design a tool that would provide Marketers with an easy way to both bring rich media engagement to their location-based mobile promotions & campaigns, and drive real-time targeted local traffic to specific locations. Augmented Reality is the tool we've used to accomplish this, not simply a tool to enable "gimmicks", like making Santa Claus dance on your coffee cup. Other AR companies have primarily been focused on the gimmick route.

Compared with competitors, CandyBAR is 10x more accurate and 3x more engaging.

Our competitors include geo-fenced SMS messaging companies:
Tatango: www.tatango.com/
ThumbVista: www.thumbvista.com/
Moasis: moasisglobal.com/

column182: KMC showcases local musicians to an audience and creates a following that they, historically, have been unable to create for themselves.
column183:
-Kryptik Music Communities's focus will be on uniting ALL local musicians into an alliance where musicians support each other by going to each others events and inviting their fans as well.  By doing so, they are left fully empowered and able to book venues that would have otherwise been inaccessible to them due to lack of patrons. There's strength in numbers.
 -There will be a uniquely designed system in place that will track which musicians are performing, which musicians are supporting, and based on how supportive they have been by the "deadline" it also decides which musicians are now selected to be the paid headlining acts at the upcoming event. There is incentive to support.
 -While only the most supportive musicians get to headline, ALL musicians are guaranteed to perform as openers based on a first register first play basis. This radical inclusion in the community is not something you will find anywhere outside of an open mic. This creates loyalty to a brand that says everyone is welcome and encouraged to participate.
 -The events will be held bi monthly, which means 6 events per year. By graphing Mo state/other states into multiple "zones" based on musician population and venues, we'll be able to host hundreds of events simultaneously 6 times per year. Due to the sheer number of events happening around the country simultaneously, Kryptic Music Communities will be seen more as a movement rather than just an event, which will further solidify its branding.
column185: I'm going to have a profound impact on the local music community by leaving them fully empowered to further their careers, full of self expression, and able to be a radical contribution to themselves and each other. It's all about community and sharing. If just one of us isn't empowered, none of us are.

column10: Creating personalized adventures catered to your interests
column16:
We are an interest based travel application that makes finding your next vacation spot an adventure in itself. Simply put, you tell us what you like to do, and we'll suggest the best places to go to do those things. 

Our application queries over 100 data points from multiple APIs to get the most accurate information for each city in the United States. Each city is then weighted based on number of reviews, average reviews, and more. We don't want to return the most populated cities with the most venues - we want to show you the best places. Those places off the beaten path.

Currently we have launched a private Alpha release of our application. Users can select any number of interests they want, and our system suggests locations with one or more of those interests - sorted by most matched of course!

column182: Is a Social Reward System, that rewards the user with usable points for their social activity, they can be redeem all across the community.
column183: What Basenji does is that it creates a platform in which users will interact with each other, as many other apps do. Our difference is that we will reward them with points (basenji points), which are redeemable through the basenji business community. Thus creating a new way to interact with users (customers) and business, via rewards. Users will get points by checkins, reviewing, sharing photos, or sharing anything involving the business community, to Basenji and other social networks. A user community is born, where they collect points, and a business community that use points to exchange for rewards, creating a new marketing tool. Another difference is that BasenjiApp is working with beacon technology to enable business communicate with users directly. (let the business speak literally). All the business interaction is controlled by Basenji dashboard, via our webpage, where beacons can be controlled (custom targeted messages), and all analytics data can be overviewed and analyzed. Yet our sole propose is for the benefit of the user getting them the best experience for their social activity.

column182: We are a contingent labor marketplace that saves businesses time and money by reducing the number of hiring mistakes made when outsourcing.
column183:
Unlike other freelance exchanges that use a proposal system, our “Talent Recommendation Engine” uses both quantitative and qualitative data to match clients with their four most compatible provider options. By aligning client and provider incentives through a merit based system that establishes price integrity, we not only help our clients find the best provider on our site, but offer a class of freelancer far superior to what can be found on today’s exchanges.

The following features differentiate our exchange from others:

Invitation-Only Matching - Most exchanges employ an open job proposal process that results in a deluge of job proposals received. Our Engine suggests the four best providers for a particular job, dramatically reducing the risk of making the wrong hire.

High-Quality Standards - Today’s exchanges are open to any provider, which means quality standards suffer. Our Engine contains three levels of provider quality control. 

Meritocratic Tier Structure - Our provider tier structure validates the prices providers can charge for their services and creates a clear path to higher earnings potential. For clients, they provide optionality at a range of prices.

Provider Focus - We are creating an egalitarian platform where both sides are given the tools to make outsourcing work easier.

Data-Driven Approach - We embrace big data by capturing on-site metrics such as response rates, milestone completion rates, and financial performance indicators like ROI.

column197:
Our Exchange business will primarily serve individuals, startups, and nonprofits who occasionally use contingent labor. We will charge these users a fee of 12.5% of the total project value of work completed on our site. 

Our Corporate business will serve SMEs, enterprises, and public sector clients who frequently use contingent labor to supplement their existing workforce. They will pay for one of two monthly subscription packages, depending on the frequency of their need for contingent labor.

We will initially rely on content marketing, SEO, social media, and word of mouth to gain user traction.

column39: Transaide helps businesses discover complementary strategic partners
column40: Partnership Development,Marketing Strategy,Consumer Insights,Analytics,Loyalty Marketing,Social Networking Sites,Consultation,Consumer Behavior,Data Analysis,Partnering,Network Architecture
column182: Transaide is a web application that helps SMB's discover complementary strategic partners to help grow their business.
column183:
The founders of Transaide spent years researching the common traits of successful businesses. One of those traits was the ability to build strategic partnerships.  Every great business had to learn to search and work with other complementary businesses to broaden their market reach and foster growth.  No one company can do everything on their own and finding strategic partners is critical to the success and growth of any venture.
The problem is strategic business partnerships are still created on the golf course or over a glass of wine. The team at Transaide developed a solution where businesses can discover complementary strategic partners online. After years of research and experience in consulting we developed a list of core traits required for a successful partnership. Using these core traits we are working on developing a Complementary Good Matching Engine (C.G.M.E) which will match and suggest partners that are best suited for them.  Finding a strategic partner is only part of the problem the other problem is leveraging the new found partnership to grow your business. We’ve all heard the horror stories of failed strategic partnerships and the team at Transaide wanted to build tools that will grant businesses the highest probability of success. This is why we working with partners to offer the best loyalty, cross marketing and consumer engagement tools.

column10: The first true merchandise ad network.
column16:
The benjamin mobile app gives the user two things: discounts on the products that they love, and sixty seconds to decide whether to buy or pass. Think Tinder/Snapchat meets deals.

We're leveraging social data and breathing some life into the deal world, and doing so with a business model that is disruptive for this space. Rather than taking a margin-crushing commission or fee on each item sold, we leverage out user experience to charge by the impression. This CPM model (commonly seen in online display advertising) has attracted unprecedented vendor buy-in from leading brands like Nike and Under Armour.

We also extend our reach via a patent-pending, proprietary ad format called Benji. Benji will be the new standard for e-commerce product re-targeting while also being the most effective advertisement for the benjamin mobile app.

The result is the first true merchandise network. We'll be able to take any vendor's merchandise and distribute it across a targeted network of web and mobile channels.
column17: CPM business model, vendor partnerships (NFL Shop, Ray Ban, Under Armour, more), unique user experience.
column39: Business development, Harvard, Feathr, Color Labs, Microsoft
column46: I was the first business hire at Feathr - I took the company from revenue-zero to a $1m run-rate in less than 11 months.
column182: benjamin gives the end-user two things: heavy discounts on the products that they love, and sixty seconds to decide whether to buy or pass.
column183:
Our platform matches the two parties through the power of big data (acquired via the social graph, app usage, as well as light/basic in-app surveys) and machine learning. Offers are presented in an engaging way: one at a time, and with sixty seconds to decide whether to buy or pass.  This introduces an element of fun – breathing life into the bargain-shopping experience.

For the vendors, we're offering direct access to the palm of a qualified buyer's hand, and we're doing so in a way that is different than Groupon or Living Social. Other deal sites use commission or fee based models but our revenue will be generated via a CPM model similar to online display advertising. This is in the best interest of all parties as it is cheap for the vendor and encourages our customers to load much more product onto the platform.
